Reviews.Title: “A mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: 186337Maria
Reviews.Content: We love Paris and had not stayed in the Sorbonne area before, we loved it and the proximity to one of our favourite gems, the Luxembourg Gardens was a determinant of our choice of hotel. The Rive Gauche Hotel is perfectly situated. The room was so small that we thought we had been wrongly allocated as we had booked a Superior room, however when I asked at reception I was told we had in fact been upgraded to a Deluxe room, we were left wondering what the difference was. Admittedly the hotel offers a high standard of decor and the bed was comfortable however there was just a tiny alcove to serve as a bedside shelf space, mirrored to give a larger appearance; only one chair and storage was adequate for only a short stay having space for only 4 hangars, no drawers and narrow shelving. In the tiny bathroom the walk-in shower was a good size although the taps offered no clues to temperature control and the hotwater temperature was almost scalding; there were no towel hooks meaning that damp towels had to be hung on the doors which then could not be closed without removing them although in fact the split doors did not meet in the middle when closed. We wondered whether this was the reason for the TV in the bathroom, to enable a degree of privacy. An irritation was the lack of a proper drinking glass, we got a very flimsy plastic disposable cup which was not replaced until we asked at the desk. We cannot comment on the quality of breakfast as we dined out.

Reviews.Title: “A weekend visit”
Reviews.Author: grumpyoldpair
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel in a very good position in central Paris. The rooms are a little quirky, but we'll fitted, modern, and definitely stylish The breakfast room in the cellar is excellent, and the buffet breakfast just fine. The Bar area is comfortable a d the drinks not expensive- for Paris The staff are friendly, efficient and have good English, the free wifi works well

Reviews.Title: “Alittle disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Ka2412
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our honeymoon, after looking at many other hotels. On arrival we were told we had been given one of the nicest rooms. When we got to it the door was open and the bed was not made/ready, there was scaffolding directly outside both windows totally obscurring what would otherwise have been a nice view. On going back to reception I was told not to worry about the room, it was nearly ready! The room was an ok size but I was disappointed that they didn't mention our honeymoon even though we had informed them. Then it got worse, the first morning we were woken before 8am to a workman directly outside the window banging and crashing, we went to reception and had an argument with them as they kept saying there was no scaffolding outside! Just as I was about to blow my top and tell them to go to the room and see for themselves they decided the scaffolding was there but it was ok because work had finished they were just taking the scaffolding down. I asked them how long it would take and to my annoyance they said it would be gone by the end of the week (we were only staying four nights). Finally they agreed we could move room but ended up with a smaller one with a rubbish view at the back of the hotel although the room was much quiter. We did recieve a small discount for the nights we were in the second room but you only have one honeymoon and ours was slightly spoilt by the experience. At the time of booking we were never informed of works taking place, otherwise we would have booked another hotel. The location of the hotel is superb however and if we had travelled a week later it would have probably been a different experience, but like I say, you only get one honeymoon...

Reviews.Title: “awful manners”
Reviews.Author: yunta
Reviews.Content: I had a trouble at the hotel when I checked out. 1. They requested the payment of the stay on site even if the bill was to be sent to the institute of work. 2. They added the morning meal that I did not have on the day of check-in. I refused both of the requests. As for the morning meal, the gentleman at the front desk continued to insist that there was the record on their computer. Finally I hit upon a good idea and showed my flight ticket which proved that I reached there in the evening on the first day. Anyway, it is ridiculous that one who checks-in in the afternoon or evening (usually) has a morning meal on the same day, but he did insist. Finally he agreed with me when I showed my flight ticket. As for the payment of the stay, it took longer time. I thought we would pay doubly by me and the institute of work if I payed there. I explained that the other gentleman who was at the front desk when I checked in also agreed that I would NOT pay for the stay and he just needed my credit card for the security reason. I strongly told them not to change the words of the contract once they agreed. Finally, the gentleman of this morning understood me personally. However, during the hot negotiation, a lady who seemed the accounting manager of the hotel showed up around 7:30 am. She insisted that I should pay. I had a quarrel with her again. I strongly refused it. It took about 30 min totally. I almost missed the RER for CDG airport. I will NEVER stay at the hotel with such such silly staff members.

Reviews.Title: “Select hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chantale56
Reviews.Content: Select hotel was amazing! The staff was friendly and helpful, even going so far as to research ticket sales for an opera my brother wanted to see. The room was clean and comfortable, and beautifully decorated, and although I'd read some reviews complaining about the small size, it's not unusual for an old building in Paris, and lends to its charm. I loved that the hotel was off a courtyard right in front of the Sorbonne, but off the main streets so it was perfect and quiet at night. I recommend it highly to everyone who wants to be in the heart of the Latin quarter. Don't miss the cactus garden below the lobby.... I didn't know it was there until I was checking out, and it was beautiful! Great design Select hotel!!! We will definitely be staying with you again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the lift fool you!”
Reviews.Author: anatomi
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a beautiful location, very close to Metro, very close to Boulevard Saint Germen and many other places as well. Very easy to reach from any airport. When I first entered the lift to go up to the 6th floor where my room was, I was really afraid, so narrow! When reached upstairs, the corridor was not a corridor, again very small and narrow. But I should congratulate the architect who designed the room - it was OK although still it was a small room. Clean enough, comfortable enough. Surprised and pleased to find a letter apologizing for the ongoing renovation outside the hotel. Breakfast was also nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel... fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: Gary B
Reviews.Content: 5th time in Paris in 8 month. All 5 times we stay at the Select Hotel. Great Location, Great Staff, Great Rooms, and Great Service. Very Modern/boutique hotel. We are going back to Select Hotel next month for 5 nights...

Reviews.Title: “Staying at Select hotel Feb. 2012”
Reviews.Author: mgravers
Reviews.Content: Breakfast very poor. Room average -> bad. No door between the bathroom and the sleepingroom. Too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dtraveldog
Reviews.Content: 3rd time to Paris,1st time at Select Hotel.Great location,very helpful staff,typical small room(aren't they all in Paris?)Very clean.Cons-No shower door(now that was an experience) and canned fruit at breakfast. Rest of breakfast was fine.Overall a great week.would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Gem by the Sorbonne”
Reviews.Author: FernandoLanzer
Reviews.Content: This is a little gem of a three-star hotel right on the Place de La Sorbonne. We often stay in the area, and this has been the best experience we've had there. The décor is a unique mix of modern and medieval, which I would call "French 8th Century Yuppie". It sounds strange, but actually works quite well: it's sleek and modern, yet cozy, combining wood panels and beamed ceilings with flat-screen TVs, mirrors and sliding doors. There's also a small TV embedded in the bathroom mirror over the sink, I nice touch: you can shave while watching the morning news... The breakfast was a bit of a disappointment, the only reason we give it four stars and not five: we did not expect an English breakfast, of course, but the bread was rather poor, not what you expect in Paris, where baguettes and pastries are typically delicious. There was only one choice of cheese and no cold cuts at all. Any 3-star hotel in the area will do better than that at breakfast. Everything else was great, though. Comfortable bed, modern bathroom, nice view of the Sorbonne entrance, attentive service, quiet room well insulated from the traffic noise below. We will surely return (and maybe have breakfast at one of the many nearby cafés...).

Reviews.Title: “Small cosy hotel, central location”
Reviews.Author: ElBow2009
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel from 2-5 February with my two sisters. The rooms are small but are warm ( Paris was freezing!) clean & very comfortable. The only real negative is the lack of a good shower (a hose and bath). The breakfast is very good. Staff were friendly. Location was great. I would recommend without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel shame about the view”
Reviews.Author: christina R
Reviews.Content: Myself and husband came to stay here as it was his birthday, i chose this hotel because of the reviews! the hotel reception and decor of the reception was very good and was looking forward to seeing our room. it was small and i got told not to worry about the workmen which would be outside of our window as they dont work saturday and sunday! we had to keep our curtains closed. i asked for an iron and was told i could go to the basement were an iron was set up, i found this not nice to do. we went out for dinner on our first night and when we got back asked if we could get a drink to take to the room, i got a large bottle of water but no glasses of offer of ice etc. the bathroom was small i like a bath but it was half the size but no shower other than a shower head which i found funny to see how my husband was going to shower! the location was good, and good walking distance to metro and sites. overall the location was good but the hotel wasnt what the pictures on there website shows!

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel in a convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: PaulStrasbourg
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel, with professional, friendly service. I had made a mistake with the booking, but they soon sorted it out for me with no fuss. The location is excellent for anyone wanting to visit the main sights in Paris. I think the room rate is what you would expect in this very good location. Access to the metro and RER stations is good. I found the shower very difficult to use, which was a bit of a nuisance, but that would not stop me from staying there again. I thought that a slightly wider choice of food could have been on offer for breakfast. At one point the staff had a bit of difficulty keeping up with the clean crockery, but to be fair it seemed that all the hotel guests had turned up for breakfast at once. Overall, I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Emmielou14
Reviews.Content: Great location although the view from my room was pretty crappy! basically just a building very close up. And scaffolding with renos going on so we had to have our curtains closed all the time unless you wanted to be upclose and personal with a french builder! My mum met us over there and her room had a lovely view of the plaza and sorbonne but the room next door was being renovated and the noise was terrible, I personally think that they should not have put any guests in the rooms right next to a building site but its France I suppose! She changed rooms with not much sympathy from the receptionist. The rooms were nicely decorated but I think they should honestly think about putting showers into the rooms as after a 24hour day of flying and airports all we wanted was a nice shower, instead we had to kneel in a bath and hold the showerhead over us as there were also no shower curtains! Breakfast was adequate. I would definately say that this was hotel was more like a travel lodge business trip place to stay if you are hoping to chill and relax in your room for some of your trip I would say stay elsewhere its great for a few days if you plan just to sleep there, I thought being Paris it would be geared up for tourist but there were no brochures trips or any information at all in the reception area and the staff really were not that interested in helping you "discover Paris". Like I said definately a business trip stopover kinda place. Location is fabulous though!!

Reviews.Title: “Run for your lives - the worst rip-off in the 5th arrondissement”
Reviews.Author: riosteve
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this hotel twice before quite some time ago, I decided to relive the past (never a good idea...) and stop here while visiting my sister, nephews and nieces in Paris this year. I had originally booked four nights (the 27th through the 31st of January) but, as Istanbul (the preceding destination on a long and very happy trip) was quite a bit colder than usual, even for this time of year, both my sister and I contacted the hotel to inquire whether it might be possibile to anticipate my earlier reservation for an extra six nights or so. NO PROBLEM, Marie-Hélène at the Sélèct promptly replied. I could stay in the very same rooom (a CHAMBRE SUPÉRIEURE AVEC VUE DE LA PLACE SORBONNE) for the same "special price" (194,25 Euros a night) except for one small detail. The first two nights would be slightly more expensive (275 Euros). What the heck, I thought... Might as well splurge... To my great consternation and amazement, as my texi pulled in to the Place de la Sorbonne I saw that the whole front of the hotel was surrounded by scaffolding. I expressed my dismay to the young man at the reception desk (alone in the hotel - there is no staff whatever to help with luggage, no doorman, nothing. Seriously.) and told him directly and politely that I was shocked the Sélèct would not have informed a returning customer of this small but important detail - no view but scaffolding from the expensive double on a high floor - and that I was there and then giving him three alternatives, to wit: (a) I would accept another room either more or less expensive anywher in the hotel that did not have scaffolding outside its window (b) I would find another hotel first thing in the morning or (c) he could give me a reduction in the expensive charges for the first two nights and I would then have more time to look for accomodations elsewhere. To my complete astonsihment, I was told by Ruholla that ALL the rooms had scaffolding outside their windows as the hotel was about to embark on extensive renovation. As for the discounted two nights, he immediately contacted Marie-Hélène by telephone and obtained authorization for a 10% discount FOR THE FIRST NIGHT. The rest, he told me with a smile, would have to be taken up with her personally the next morning. Tired after my flight from Turkey and a colossal Sunday night traffic jam on the way into Paris from Cahrles de Gaulle, I trudged up to my room (only to discover that the door on the only elevator in the hotel - yes, the one I was to find out the very next morning would be shared by construction workers and guests for the duration of my stay and the renovation - was jamming). I was informed that this would be taken care of immediately, that the elevator maintenance people had just been contacted. On a Sunday evening. You Think? Arriving in my room, I called to order room service only to be told there was none, in spite of the rather extensive menu on the teensy weensy "desk" facing my bed. Aghast, I hung up and sat there, contemplating the prospect of having to go out on a Sunday night looking for drinking water (there are no mini-bars in the rooms either, by the way). At this point, the phone rang and Ruhola informed me that there actually WAS room service, albeit for drinks only. So I got my mineral water (which HE broought to my door minutes later). Breakfast was desultory and truly dreadful - the other guests looked miserable, probably as a result of the fact that plastic sheeting had begun to be laid on all the floors VERY early that morning and that the workmen who were working on the renovation were now sharing the minuscule lift with the faulty door with all the hotel guests, many of whom could be seem using the stairs in various states of desperation. This story has a happy ending, though. As soon as I had finished my coffee, I found another hotel I had also stayed at in other visits to Paris (a city I dearly love and have visited on so many occasions I have lost count of the total number). My request for a room was accepted on the spot. Reception was warm and friendly for almost half the price of the Sélèct, with continental breakfast thrown in as a courtesy. Beware of the Sélèct and its mercenary prices (for the precious little that they offer their guests) and thoroughly dishonest and disrespectful business practices. Forwarned is forearmed. And enjoy Paris!

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Willbeck
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on Trip Advisor, we selected this hotel for our trip to Paris. We were NOT disappointed! Talk about location - we were within walking distance of Notre Dame, Sainte Chapelle, the Louvre, Luxembourg Gardens & and the Pantheon. We were also near public transportation to easily get to the Arc de Triomphe & the Eiffel Tower. The hotel is just off a main street on a dead end so it is very quiet and peaceful. The breakfasts were terrific and the staff very helpful. As with most European hotels, the room was small but it was very nice. From the standpoint of being in a great location and getting a great place to stay on a reasonable budget, this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Rick G
Reviews.Content: this is a great location and very interesting botique hotel. You must stay in the front poriton of the hotel that faces the plaza. The rooms are small but clean and well appointed. The only negative is that they do not have a concierge. Front desk staff attempt to help but they are not skilled at planning so you must do that on your own. Would definitely stay there again while in Paris as the location and style is well worth the price which is a value

Reviews.Title: “New Year 2012 at The Select Hotel Paris”
Reviews.Author: DavidO O
Reviews.Content: The location of this city hotel is very good. However, the airconditioning is only available in the summer and the heating is so hot that the only way to be able to sleep was opening the window. If you have a front of hotel roon this is fine, but otherwise you open directly onto scaffolding with protective sheeting that makes a real racket in the rain. So be deafened, or roast. The door to our bathroom came off its rail which had apparently happened before. The hotel could not resolve this, no privacy between room and bathroom for 3 people sharing for 2 days and no apology or recompense. A real shame because although some of the rooms are tiny, it is still pleasant and very well located.

Reviews.Title: “great location, cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: alex b
Reviews.Content: Perfect for a stay in the heart of the latin quarter's small streets, boutiques, cafes, bookstores. I loved it very comfortable, and nice helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful room and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: loingboing
Reviews.Content: We have just three wonderful days in Paris staying at this hotel. The room was very nice and comfortable. The wifi was a bit slow but on the other hand it was included in the price, something I really appreciate. A real French breakfast was served in the room. The location is perfect, close to the RER which goes straight to the airport and close to whatever you want to do in Paris. I will definitely stay here next time!

Reviews.Title: “Very confortable”
Reviews.Author: Pinods
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very confortable and placed in a wonderful central square. The rooms are small but confortable. The breakfast is good.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Characterful”
Reviews.Author: geegas
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a quiet street facing a square with several restaurants. It is definitely one of the best nights I have spent in Paris for a long time. Good value for money and very classy interior including the bedrooms. The rooms may be small but I would rather stay here on business trips in the future than at many of the more expensive chain hotels. Excellent staff that remained helpful even during the early morning rush hour of departures and check-outs. Small basic breakfast in very pleasant setting. To top it all a view of some beautifully maintained historical buildings from the bedroom window!

Reviews.Title: “Bathroom”
Reviews.Author: JUANEG
Reviews.Content: Please repair bathroom taps Please repair bathroom tapsPlease repair bathroom taps

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel,”
Reviews.Author: ginm77
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and helpful, the location was excellent and the room was comfortable, stylish and cozy. Overall a great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms but great location!”
Reviews.Author: apple_tini80
Reviews.Content: This place has tiny tiny tiny tiny teeeeeeeeeeeny tiny rooms! The elevator to our room was SUPER super tiny... it barely fit 2 people. However, the rooms were clean and the staff were nice. The only thing that was puzzling was that there was a bar downstairs but it was never really open... The hotel is located in the Latin Quarter, right in front of the University. The location is excellent... only a short walk to the shops and restaurants and the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: DaddyOW
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Select Hotel during a long weekend with my wife and got what we wanted: a clean, well-situated, no-nonsense and relatively cheap place to stay. The room was small (although we booked a triple) but not claustrophobic. Bed was comfortable, bathroom very clean (strangely no shower curtain) and noise levels were low despite having a ground floor room (and being right next to the Sorbonne). Breakfast was rudimentary, although popular - get there before 08:30 otherwise you'll have to queue. The great thing was the location - many of the "musts" to see were within walking distance and the train station (RER line) to the airport only ten minutes away. We booked via the web and got a 30% discount on the going rate. If we go back we'd most likely stay at the same place - if nothing else since we can find our way about!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect combination”
Reviews.Author: Camilla150
Reviews.Content: Booked it based on other reviews from Tripadvisor. Must say it was a perfect combination of fair price, great location close to everything (+metro) and hotel experience. Professional staff, OK breakfast buffé, design and cleaness. Great choice for a four day mother and daughter (14 years) holiday in Paris. Will stay there again, but make sure to get a room towards Place de la Sorbonne. We had a room towards the street. No traffic noise, but this side of the hotel was under outside renovation in november, so no sight from the window and noisy from am 8.30.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong”
Reviews.Author: shazausa
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked this hotel based on other reviews from tripadvisor which were completely accurate. Location, location, location....we were able to walk to every major sight and for those who prefer, there are 2 metro stops minutes away. The friendly and polite staff exceeded our expectations by going above and beyond any other hotel staff I've come across in quite some time. It was great to have breakfast included for convenience and value. The room was clean and comfortable. It was a tad strange to have the toilet seperate from the bathroom and that there was nowhere to hang towels. But all in all, you can't go wrong by choosing this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Uri C
Reviews.Content: My wife and me were impressed by the staff of the hotel. They were helpfull and polite. Ther location of Select hotel is fantastic. Our room was nice and comfortable, cleaned on time and well equipped/ We are going to reccomand the Select Hotel to our freinds.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect but good value: good room and well located”
Reviews.Author: SeamasterFrance
Reviews.Content: I stayed twice at this hotel and overall, it's a good choice. Rates are fair compared to what you get and room size is OK. Pros: - Nice room: design, convenient and clean (though a bit more of storage space would be good) - Very clean bathroom - Very bright room with a great light on the Place de la Sorbonne - Great location near the Jardin du Luxembourg Cons: - Very average breakfast with industrial orange juice and limited choice - Wooden shades to block the light have limited effect and when the sun rises, your room is already enlightened (if you like to sleep in the dark, it's a clear miss) Conclusion: Quite a good choice at a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Bustling location and easy metro access”
Reviews.Author: JackieC53
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 4 night in October 2011. The location is great with easy access to metro, Luxembourg Gardens, Pantheon, and restaurants. The rooms are small but then again it is central Paris. The location has two very different atmospheres - one when Sorbonne University is in session and another on weekends. We enjoyed both during our visit. We had a room with window onto a courtyard and found it quiet after 10 p.m. No problems sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: GlobalSmurfs
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel! The hotel itself is very nice, modern, and clean. The location is fantastic and only a few minuted walk from the Latin Quarter and Notre Dame Cathedral plus have tons of great restaurants within minutes of the hotel. Convienent access to public transportation. Very accommodating staff and very clean rooms, we have stayed at this hotel twice and will definitively return.

Reviews.Title: “great location and chic decor”
Reviews.Author: swissmiss001
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at the Select Hotel. I've stayed at many 3 star hotels in Paris and this is one that I like coming back to. The neighborhood is great and it's a convenient location with easy access to metro and RER. What sets this hotel apart from other 3 star hotels for me is the chic decor. I stayed as a single this time in a room on the first floor with view of the inner courtyard. I loved the wooden beams in the ceiling, the stone walls, and the chic, contemporary bathroom. (see my photos). I love the vaulted room downstairs where breakfast is served, although the breakfast is average for this type of hotel. The hotel was very full and busy when I arrived, but I was able to check in early, before the normal arrival time. The staff were friendly and helpful. There was free, in room wifi which is something I always look for when choosing a hotel. On a previous visit, about 3 years ago, I stayed in a top floor room with a view on the Place de la Sorbonne. I really enjoyed that view, but was looking for a less expensive room this time. This is a hotel that I will come back to and one that I will recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Paris”
Reviews.Author: dog_friendly60763
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just fine, nothing special and the rooms are TINY - even by Paris standards. However, the location cannot be beat. Close to St. Germain de Pres, the Sorbonne (right outside the front door of the hotel) the Luxembourg Gardens and a very short walk to Notre Dame. Also, there are three pretty good cafes right outside the hotel in an enclosed area, so no traffic noise!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Welcoming Staff”
Reviews.Author: susiede
Reviews.Content: Hotel located within a 5 minute walk from the RER B line from Charles DeGaulle Airport-very welcome after a long flight. It affords privacy off the a main street but seconds away from Cafes and Shopping. Sitting at the next door cafe people watching very relaxing and enjoyable. Room modern and more than adequate while not huge was very comfortable. Would highly recommend. Within walking distance of Notre Dame, the Seine and many areas of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: lamia68
Reviews.Content: Location can't be beat. Within walking distance to the Airport RER B line and the Metro, as well as all the main sites like the Louvre and Notre Dame. Easy access to all the restaurants and night clubs in the Latin Quarter. Room was comfortable, with modern feel, and very clean. Good linens and very comfortable bed. Spotless bathroom. Free breakfast and wireless internet were a major PLUS. The only draw back is that I requested an extra pillow and never got one. They seemed to have made the effort to look for one and did not found one, which I thought was odd for a hotel of this category. Also they should install shower curtains since the bath tubs are equipped with showers and it splashes everywhere when you use them.

Reviews.Title: “Let down”
Reviews.Author: Quave
Reviews.Content: What should be a first rate experience - great location, friendly staff, lots of eye-catching details like old beams and breakfast in the vaulted cellars - became a second-rate one through errors and a lack of interest in correcting them. We paid a little extra for a room with "a view of the winter gardens". What we got was a view of scaffolding, and when we pointed out this was not what we booked, one of the managers' only response was to say that they have to renovate otherwise guests complain. Yes they do - but we shouldn't have to pay extra for a view of the ongoing work. When pushed, the only alternative room offered was distinctly inferior and both had various minor things that weren't working (a light, a fan, a TV in the bathroom...but who needs a TV in the bathroom). It is a pity - what for them was one of their rooms for a couple of nights was for us supposed to be a romantic weekend in a room with a view in Paris, and their lack of understanding about not delivering what was promised slightly soured what was otherwise a memorable couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “location”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadagain567
Reviews.Content: RER from CDG airport is 5 mins walk away. The hotel is set in a square with several cafes where there is no traffic, yet a main road is yards away. 10 mins walk takes you down to the Seine, closer still is the metro for travel around Paris. The surrounding area has lots of cafes/bars very close by and feels safe to walk around. The decor was clean and modern. The front desk were friendly and helpful. Marie Helen especially deserves credit, she gave us lots of advice re tours etc. The rooms were fine by Paris standards, seperate toilet and bathroom. Safe, TV, free wifi etc. Breakfast consisted of coffee/tea/juice/cereal/bread only. Its not 5 star but you are not paying 5 star price, the service is good for a city hotel, the location is excellent, we would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, room and breakfast!Excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Luciana P
Reviews.Content: Catherine, the receptionist was really nice, after we arrived she showed two rooms for me and my husband and asked which one we liked better.Both rooms with shower like we asked her by email. (If you don't want to end up in a room with just a bath tub and no shower, make sure you call at the hotel before making reservation to check about this, since no shower and bath tubs with no curtains are very common in some places in Europe.). The hotel has a nice decoration, it is located very close to metro and RER (take the RER to get to the hotel from the airport), our room was small but tastefully decorated, the room service was good with clean sheets and new towels each day and breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Will not go back”
Reviews.Author: dukeofsudbury
Reviews.Content: I travel to Europe to visit friends and family at least twice a year. I understand that European hotels do not have the same calibre of service as Canadian and American hotels (partly because the whole continent is so foreign to gratuities). This hotel was not satisfactory at all. Their service at the front desk was medicore and their rooms were very tiny, with limited amentities. The breakfast is totally not worth it, it's a bunch of carbs...and look store bought! The orange juice was always warm and their coffee was horrible. THE WORST part, the sheets and towels were cleaned using a heavy dose of bleach and non-hypoallergenic detergent...sounds like i'm being a diva but i was itching every time i dried myself off from a shower...two rooms down my friends had the same problem. the location is great, the rooms are bad...they make you miss home. Don't be lured in by the breakfast. Spend a couple of Euros and get a breakfast in a cafe on the streets of Paris. Wi-Fi was strong, but who cares, other hotels have Wi-Fi. Don't stay at this hotel...and if you do, enjoy the elevator, it fits two European adults!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: natalie_1111
Reviews.Content: The hotel is at a central location in the Latin quarter, close to several metro stations, jardins de Luxemburg, Bvd. San-Michel and Bvd. San-Germains. The hotel itself is small but very stylish, unlike most of the old-fashioned hotels in the area. I recieved a double bed room on the last floor, facing place de la sorbonne. The room was large, very clean, and very butifully decorated. The only disadvantage was the service - the consierge wasn't much help with anything: when I arrived I had to literally "milk" every piece of information out of her ("what time is breakfest?", "when is check out time?", "do you have a map?" ect.) and when I asked about ways to get to the airport I was advised to "look it up on the internet". All in all it was a very good experience - I made my reservation based on reviews and photos I saw on tripadvisor, and when I got there, the hotel exceeded my expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and lovely room! Best value!”
Reviews.Author: FlutterbyCCC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location for visiting the Latin quarter and St Germain. Easy to reach by RER from CDG. The hotel is on the Place de La Sorbonne, which is a charming square with several outdoor bistros. The room itself was air conditioned, clean, and decently sized for the price category. The breakfast was great and included in the room price, which is a treat these days as most hotels now charge at least ten euros per person. The only thing that would have made it better was some fresh fruit. Overall, we highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, central location”
Reviews.Author: Alymac73
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel, located in the heart of the left bank, just off the main St Michel boulevard, close to metro and Luxemborg Gardens. The rooms were small but average by Parisian standards - tastefully decorated and the room services with clean sheets and towels each day. We had a nice bright room overlooking the square which was very pleasant. The breakfast was basic, bread, cheese, cereals, I would have liked a hot option also - have stayed in Paris several times and always offered a hot alternative, however it was ok. I would have given this a 4 star rating but when we returned I realised I had left my car key in the safe and phoned the hotel to ask them to post it to me and they would only do this if I paid for the postage (which wouldn't have been more than 5 euro) - I thought this was a bit mean considering I had just spent the guts of 800 euro in accommodation. For this reason I would not return to this hotel - maybe I'm old fashioned but its the small things that count sometimes!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: dvdai
Reviews.Content: The Select Hotel Rive Gauche is perfectly situated in a lovely square in a nice area of Paris.It is about 500 metres from Cluny la Sorbonne Metro station and about 800/1000 metres from Notre Dame and The Seine. The walk down to the river passes some high class shops,cafe bars and restaurants leading to an area of small cobbled streets filled with restarants, bars, gift shops etc (this area becomes alive and vibrant on a night). The Hotel is very modern inside with all things looking new and clean. Our room was smaller than a Travel lodge room but not by much and had a shower/toilet room, all new and clean also. We have stayed in Paris previously, this time we spent 2 nights here and found nothing at all to fault. I would definately recommend this Hotel and the location it is in

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull relaxing stylish hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: SusieD8
Reviews.Content: WE had probably one of the best rooms in the hotel overlooking La Sorbonne and the square. Beds were very comfortable and the hotel clean and stylish . Breakfast was a little crazy as there was so little room to move in the breakfast room and no where to sit if busy. However this did not spoil the stay. Location was perfect , within walking distance of Notre DAme and the Louvre and St Germain area. Loved it and would recommend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Recommended! It was lovely! Thank you very much!”
Reviews.Author: HappyCoupleBLN
Reviews.Content: We were staying at Select Hotel for 3 nights. The staff is very friendly and it is perfectly located near the luxembourg subway. Breakfast is included but don't expect a wide range of choices. Do it like the French and dip your croissant into your coffee. We recommend to do some jogging in the morning to explore the city. Starting at the hotel you can visit Eifel Tower, Arc de Triomphe, Champs Elysees, Notre Dame and Louvre on a 14km loop.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Jim_Neglia
Reviews.Content: located in the heart of saint Michelle we could not have asked for better! The hotel appearance was warm and easy on my eyes, the staff was exceptionally attentive to our needs and the rooms were spotless and clean. Breakfast for 6€ we much more then continental but no warm items on the menu. Breads, cheeses, cereal of all sorts of varieties juices, coffee, jellies and jams. All wonderful with absolutely no complaint. The rooms are warm and I found the bed to be very comfortable. My boys had a separate room which was equally as comfortable and clean. The upside to this hotel is the location and friendly staff along with the cleanliness of the facility. Down side... Nothing!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ErikIngeneeger
Reviews.Content: In the midst of St Germain, the Select Hotel in Paris is a great place to stay in Paris. The rooms weren't very big, although decent for Paris standards, but clean and well-kept. Service was friendly. Place de la Sorbonne is very nice with a few fine brasseries on and around the square. Chech-out time at 12:00 was also very comfortable. We very much enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Glenn D
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 10 days. As you may read in other reviews, yes, the room is small but it worked fine for us (just some basic organizational skills and all is good). But who comes to Paris to sit in the hotel room? The room does not have a shower - only a bathtub with a personal sprayer. This took some getting used too but also added to the charm of the trip. Actually, I appreciated the large and deep bathtub to relax the muscles after all the walking (seeing the sites in Paris). The staff were very friendly and this was probably one of the cleanest rooms I have ever enjoyed (I travel a fair bit for business). The location of the hotel cannot be beat in my opinion. Close to the metro, parks, historical attractions, and stores very close by. We were out at night and never felt unsafe in the general area by the hotel. Before going, I read the reviews and saw the comments on the hotel breakfast (if you choose that option). I agree, you do not have the selection in menu when compared with US or other European hotels (e.g. Amsterdam) but it is acceptable and does have a few $$$ (quite a few) when compared to catching breakfast at a nearby cafe. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: HWho
Reviews.Content: The Select Rive Gauche is in a pretty square five minutes walk from the cheap eateries of the Latin Quarter, three metro staions are nearby and also a short walk to the Notre Dam Cathedral and the banks of the Seine. A fabulous location to explore the city and it's possible to reach many of the big sights on foot. We found the staff to be charming and helpful. They obviously enjoyed their jobs and took pride in the hotel. Our room (12) was are exceptionally clean, well thought out and full of interesting design features. A far higher standard than expeced from a three star hotel. It was the best hotel I have ever stayed in in Paris by a long shot. I would not hesitate to stay there each time I visit the city from now on and I would certainly recommend to friends and family. Having this hotel as a base made our trip to lovely Paris complete.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Les2647
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in June for 4 nights. It was excellent, the room was cleaned every day and when you came back to your room clean towels and sheets were waiting for you. The breakfast room was lovely and the staff were very friendly. I would highly recommend this hotel as it is in a really good spot for the train station and metro. Lots of lovely restaurants right next door and all around. Would use this one again for my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: cynthgren
Reviews.Content: Would thoroughly recommend this hotel for postion, facilities, friendliness. Breakfast was very good but, in addition, would have liked a choice of egg.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel, Would definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: Del2286
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated on the actual Place de la Sorbonne and is a 3 minute walk to the Luxembourg Gardens. It is about 5 mins to the metro station (Cluny la Sorbonne) which runs an RER B to and from Charles de Gaulle Airport. Alternatively the hotel offer a private taxi to CDG but it cost 60 euro. The staff were extremely polite and helpful. Room was very clean and beautifully designed. The only thing we found strange was that the hose for the shower is situated about 6 inches above the bath so you must either sit into the bath or hold it and try not drench the place!! The walls are not particularly sound proof as you can hear doors banging all the time. ..Other than that we found the room very comfortable. It is also air conditioned.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CanadianRosemary
Reviews.Content: The room was great, the breakfast was complete, and the staff was helpful. It was conveniently located near Metro and RER and easy walking distance to the bustling Latin Quarter. I would definitely recommend this hotel. It is also located on a pedestrian "place" which makes it nice and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved our stay here!”
Reviews.Author: hellooothereee
Reviews.Content: If you ever happen to go to Paris, I really reccomend this hotel. It is in the centre of Paris, and a 10 minute walk to Notre Dame de Paris. The service was excellent, the rooms were clean and very modern, there is free wi-fi and the breakfast was excellent. Overall, I really suggest this hotel to you, you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Guests don't like to be told that they are fabricating a problem”
Reviews.Author: frischome
Reviews.Content: the drain in the shower is not adaquate. I took a 10 minute shower the first morning and the bedroom flooded. When I reported this to the front desk, they said one of the staff checked and the shower is fine- I must have been standing on the drain. Knowing that I had not stood on the drain, from then on we would only let the ceiling shower run for one minute before turning it off. The carpet was wet throughout our stay. It will flood the next time a guest takes a shower because nothing was done about the drain- the problem was "solved" by blaming me- the guest for the problem. Also, I realize space is at a premium but to put the toiulet in one place and the sink at the opposite end of the suite makes no sense. Clearly, 2 sinks are needed.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Jeff_GD26
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a great location, very close to metro stops, and only about a twenty minute walk from the Seine. The rooms were relatively small, and lacked some amenities like a minibar, but were still decent. The elevator was also quite small, and sometimes inconsistent, so we often had to take the stairs. We also had breakfast included in our stay, which was a very simple meal every morning (mainly pastries, some cereals, etc.) but were nevertheless a nice touch to start the morning. Getting a table was never an issue. For those looking to stay in a great location in Paris, in a decent hotel, it's worth the stay. If you want something a bit nicer, we'd suggest springing the extra money for a nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: laxMom106
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my two teenage kids. Our triple room was quite small, but by European standards, probably average size. The hotel was clean, quiet (when the window was shut, otherwise a lot of screaming outside during the night), and had A/C. The staff seemed pretty competent, except for one gentleman who could not find our key and basically accused my son of either losing it or leaving in the room (when the rest of us saw my son put it on their counter as we were walking out). The breakfast was decent, but no protein except for cheese. The location was convenient and there were several restaurants next door. We walked a couple of blocks to get to a Metro, and were located several blocks south of the Notre Dame.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely will return”
Reviews.Author: miami_f2003
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at the Hotel Select during June 22 - June 29th. The staff was very friendly and pleasant. If we needed anything it was available. I will definitely return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are too small”
Reviews.Author: Roland_8
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just didn't have room for our suitcases, and the closet was ridiculous. The rooms are just too small to be comfortable for two people. The elevator is also comfortable enough, but only for one person with a suitcase. The lobby is beautiful, but that is where the hotel puts its money. They failed to call taxis when we asked, and even our taxi to the airport didn't show up. A Japanese family was one hour late leaving for the airport because their taxi didn't show up either. Good location near the Luxembourg Gardens.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovelydays_26
Reviews.Content: Visited Paris last month and stayed in this lovely hotel for 2 nights. Great location in heart of paris and very close to station. It is also close to many attractions in paris. Very cosy rooms, perfect for couples. Staff was very helpful. Lovely breakfast included as well.

Reviews.Title: “I could stay here again, but would also be just as likely to look elsewhere in the same neighbourhood.”
Reviews.Author: SKL2011
Reviews.Content: I stayed with one other person in the superior room for two people with one double bed. Fortunately, neither of us are large people and we each had only one small carry-on-sized suitcase. However, I still found the room small. The bed took up most of the space and I felt like I only had about three feet of walking space around the bed. The room was very quiet as were only two guest rooms on my floor and the room faced away from the street. It was great having air conditioning in the room. I enjoyed the continental breakfast which included cheese, yogourt, and fruit in addition to bread, pastries, cereal, milk, juice, coffee, and tea. The service from the front desk was prompt and professional. The towels, bedding, bathroom, closets were clean, but the dark carpeting and stains on the walls (greasy hand prints?) worried me a little. The location was excellent. It was close to the metro, main tourist attractions, and reasonable restaurants. As two female travellers, both my friend and I felt safe in that neighbourhood even late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Well What We Hoped For In Paris!”
Reviews.Author: 231098Marcello
Reviews.Content: Paris was the final leg of an amazing family European vacation and we arrived in Paris quite tired and hoping our hotel would help make it the greatest. We were not disappointed. We were warmly recieved by a wonderful lady (receptionist) who immediately made us feel very welcome . She even took the time to do a walk around with us to point out the key areas of the modest hotel built on several floors, and then provided us with a prepacked folder containing maps and places to see in Paris (an interesting surprise). This lady also was very helpful in answering our questions, mostly for directions and how to weave our way to key Paris sites by subway. As most rooms in Europe which are usually small, these ones were reasonable in comparison AND they had airconditioning! There is also a small usefull elevator as the stairs are steep and winding. The washrooms were very clean and fairly modern. The beds were thankfully very comfortable. As most areas in Paris there is a lot of noise due to traffic until about 3am and mercifully you could kill the noise by closing the hotel windows. A pleasant surprise was free internet. There are also safety boxes in the room. A little disappointment was the breakfast (included in price) which had limited selection and was the same every morning so we found ourselves hungry shortly after, and headed for the restaurants! The hotel location is very interesting. Place de La Sorbonne, which is a small car free square just off the university campuses and only 2 blocks from an amazing car free zone (several old typically French blocks with romantic narrow winding streets) filled with bistros, restaurants and souvenir shops, cordonned off by churches and small museums. A very pleasant surprise. The hotel is also about 4 blocks of pleasant walk (St Michel Blvd) to the bridge which crosses over to the Notre Dame Cathedral area. Also the subway is one block away, a must after a few days of walking. Just a note of interest that the hotel is near the university campuses so there are a lot of students walking around which we actually found refreshing and interesting. I would recommend this hotel for romantic getaways, for families with children old enough to appreciate bistros and walks through narrow streets and for all who are interested to take a break from the rat race with no forwarding address! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, fine breakfast and we will definitely be back !”
Reviews.Author: halind
Reviews.Content: The Place de la Sorbanne in front is very nice, lively, and relaxing. Everything is very close and walkable - Notre Dame is easy walk as is Seine and the boats. Plenty of food choices close by near San Michelle metro. Internet is FREE !!! Front desk ladies were very nice and helpful with everything. When some of us got sick, they arranged appointments with a doctor nearby immediately and helped us. They were quite knowledgeable about travel information for Paris. Breakfast was great - coffee was terrific, and the service was great ! Friendly, lively, cheerful ! We will definitely have this hotel as the plan of record hotel for our future visits to Paris !

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Aussiesawayfromhome
Reviews.Content: Great location! You can take the metro, the tour bus or walk to many different and wonderful sights around the city. Even just wandering around the area can take you a couple of days and you will enjoy every minute of it. The hotel is not inexpensive but it is difficult to find a good hotel in Paris we found for much less. This hotel provides a delicious breakfast included in the cost. The hotel is comfortable and quiet, the staff very helpful and friendly. It is not terribly spacious but this too is typical of Paris hotels. Again, the location is ideal for anyone wanting to have a good look around Paris. We would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “romantic anniversary”
Reviews.Author: munchable
Reviews.Content: great location: Beautiful courtyard with fountain and cafes. helpful, friendly staff 2 good restaurants immediately outside the hotel rent a bicycle to get around! Amazingly cheap and there are many rental and drop off locations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at a nice location”
Reviews.Author: Erica5349
Reviews.Content: A small, modern and nice located hotel. Great service and comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “"Right next door to an angel" (Sorbonne) on a car free, fountained street.”
Reviews.Author: 34oceanspirit
Reviews.Content: Subway close, and train in from CDG stops within walking distance. 2 blocks. Our first time here we had a top floor room on the street--incredible. This time onto the courtyard, and a smaller room, but very nice. We expect smaller in Europe. It would have been fine, but remembering the first, special room, it was a disappointment. I would stay here again, absolutely. Breakfast is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel in a very good location.”
Reviews.Author: Lager024
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very good for a shopping weekend. The rooms are clean but very small. We stayed in a room with a view of Place de La Sorbonne and it was quite noisy. Not enough hangers for clothes when you stay 2 persons in the room. No where to put your towels in the bathroom. We experienced huge problems with the free WiFi! The breakfast buffet is typical French, quite boring with not so much to choose from. The staff at the front desk were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, OK stay”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneTravels19
Reviews.Content: I stayed here before about 10 years ago, and the location is hard to beat. My room faced the beautiful Sorbonne square. You can walk to many of the attractions, go to cafes and shop, all on foot. My stay was OK, but I was not happy with the visible layer of dust on the bathroom shelf, and the fact that the WiFi did not work at all in the room (the latter was confirmed by the hotel staff with an unsympathetic "sorry"). The stay included a very good breakfast. I would recommend the hotel because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value!”
Reviews.Author: Evka35
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in May 2011. It is located at St. Germain quarter, right in front of a fountain, great little square with restaurants and next to the Sorbone university. The best thing about this hotel is its superb location, walking distance to Notre Dame and other attractions. Only bad thing was that the room for 3 people had a very small bed for the 3rd person. However, that was a minor thing and everything else about this hotel was great. Breakfast is included so you can start your day off in Paris right.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jacksonl
Reviews.Content: clean, near everything (RER, Metro, Seine) very confortable and the service is excellent, definitly I recommended it

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location in Sorbonne square.”
Reviews.Author: MelLuvsCharlie
Reviews.Content: The location can't be beat. The rooms are modern but a bit small which is normal for Europe. Still space to move around and not feel cramped. Toilet is in a separate "room" from sink and tub/shower so after using the toilet you have to go to the other room to wash your hands. Tub is definitely narrow like a canoe. Not recommended for soaking. All is modern, though so it makes up for a lot. Breakfast is "Eh". Breakfast better at Artus Hotel. Would recommend, though. Would go back. Location and view of square is cool.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: vdunbar
Reviews.Content: The most was made of this standard European-sized single room; clean with excellent lighting and updated fixtures. An excellent location; a leisurely 40-minute walk from Gare Montparnasse, less than 10 minute walk from the Metro with access to the RER B line from Roissy-Charles de Gaulle. Hotel was quiet, including on Friday and Saturday nights. For those who need it, front desk was continually staffed with personnel who spoke both French and English.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location – Lovely Staff”
Reviews.Author: Akai
Reviews.Content: This hotel is modern, clean, attractive, and far better than you would expect for a 3 star hotel. It has some lovely features, including three different lounge areas leading from the lobby, and a nice area with cactus and water features going down to where the breakfast room is. There is a small but adequate lift. We had a front facing room on the corner of the 3rd floor, which had the majestic Eglise de la Sorbonne as our view to the right. There are trees lining the front of the hotel, so if you want a view you would probably need a room from the 3rd floor upwards. When we arrived, the fountains and cafes nearby seemed loud and lively, but the room had double-glazed windows which shut off all noise when closed. The bathroom was clean and modern, with a bath and hand-held showerhead. Everything was kept clean throughout our stay. The hotel staff were absolutely lovely – various front desk staff were so helpful and friendly, and the night desk man was always happy to deal with our many random questions! Everything was run very efficiently: we had problem with one of the lights and reported it one morning, and by the time we came back that afternoon, all was fixed and done. When we requested room-service breakfast, it was delivered at the time we requested, beautifully presented. Downstairs in the breakfast room the buffet breakfast was good (would maybe have been nice to get some meats or different cheeses), but was perfectly adequate in very clean & attractive surroundings. We went down quite early and didn't have any problem getting a table. The hotel is really close to various metro stations (Cluny La Sorbonne, Odeon, St-Michel), and the Paris Metro is very quick and efficient. This area is also in easy walking distance to sites like Notre Dame, the Seine, Jardin du Luxembourg – not to mention the enjoyment of just wandering around the little streets of the Latin Quartier. The hotel is in a lovely area of Paris, and so convenient for everything (including a handy Monoprix round the corner). Select Hotel is a great hotel to stay at - the location and lovely staff make it everything you could want.

Reviews.Title: “overall very good, perfect location but lacks of refrigator”
Reviews.Author: feryalhaerdinow1
Reviews.Content: Spring and summer times weather is hot and warm in Paris ,a refrigator in the rooms is necessary ! And no need for a trendi Sallandsbowl as lavatory ,please! Also why Single bed rooms allways facing backyards? Really fed up with this, is it because travelling alone and female 50+?

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: YorkshiremanOntario
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are second to none. Everything about our stay was fantastic. I would rscommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - you looked after us very well”
Reviews.Author: RossAnd_11
Reviews.Content: A comfortable hotel in a great location, with helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Would choose this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: cpmeyer
Reviews.Content: Great location, at a nice square and close to the town centre. A very friendly and helpful staff. The hotel is in good condition and seems well organized. Breakfast is fine and provides a good start for a day in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: christinejoan
Reviews.Content: We were given two upgrades on our room which we had booked in conjunction with our Eurostar ticket. The staff were welcoming and efficient, the room clean and comfortable and the breakfast good. The hotel is in a great location just by the Sorbonne with Notre Dame, Bld St Germain, the Louvre etc and countless restaurants all within easy walking distance. The room was a little on the small size so the twin beds had to be right next to each other but otherwise this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Small, chic, friendly”
Reviews.Author: cotter42
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay in this Latin Quarter hotel. The rooms are small but perfectly formed, the breakfast is included in the room price (unusual in Paris) and the staff are charming and helpful. Place Sorbonne itself is a gorgeous small square with a lovely fountain and great restaurants. It is within easy walking distance to the Seine and all its attractions. My mother and I have visited Paris many times before, but thanks to the Select Hotel staff's good advice were able to use the bus system for the first time.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and good value”
Reviews.Author: vacationer0
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff, warm and welcoming reception. Smaller rooms typical of European hotels but completey modernized hotel with a Miam sort of feel. Spotless and great breakfast buffet. Decent sized and modernized bathroom, too. Good location about six blocks south of Notre Dame.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Emerduffy
Reviews.Content: Excellent location,modern hotel,friendly staff,lifts very small

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: LPC920
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. It's quiet, charming and well-located, right near Luxembourg Gardens -- great for running -- and several of the metros and RER. English-speaking staff was very helpful, rooms were extremely clean, breakfast was fine. Rooms are typically European postage-stamp-sized ones and there is no American-style shower - only a hand-held showerhead. If you can live with that, this is an excellent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “it was like being at home and on holiday at the same time!!”
Reviews.Author: pedrofinia
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel in the spring of 2011 and had a lovely time . the location is perfect a beautifull square with fountains at the main entrance to sorbonne university. only 10 mins walk from notre dame in the very beautifull latin quarter. the rooms were clean and spacious enough and the breakfast was a lovely continental all very fresh every day.the staff we found very helpfull and freindly and nothing was to much trouble particulary catherine on reception who went right out of her way to give me some great tips on some lovely french reds to bring home and I was not dissapointed.there are loads of cool bars and restaraunts near bye but important tip my wife was very badly food poisened at a morocan place on rue xavier privas we were told afterwards not to eat anywhere down this street no matter how inviting and persuasive the owners are!! you have been warned!! great hotel though and we highly recomend it!!

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to its recommendation”
Reviews.Author: Sheila_Gray
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by a friend who has stayed at The Select several times having lived and taught in the Sorbonne area. The location is fantastic: museums, gardens etc. all close at hand. The area around Odeon and St. Germain has some lovely "people watching" restaurants and a distinct lack of English/American tourists. There are also two restaurants next door to the hotel if you are too tired to go out again. We had booked a room with a garden but we arrived early and were offered an alternative room on the side of the building, which turned out to be very quiet. The room itself was a bit strange as it had a modern shell built into an old room. The only thing I didn't like was the loo which was very small, dark, and had Japanese style maroon tiles on the wall: dusty and not too clean looking. The light was dim and it must be a nightmare for the cleaner to try to clean. Reception staff were smart, professional and very helpful. I managed to order Room Service one morning (the Room Service staff don't speak English) in my very basic French but then couldn't make myself understood the next day when I tried to order tea. The waiter got quite annoyed, came to the room and then just threw up his hands when he discovered what I wanted - he didn't get a tip. I would definitely stay at The Select on a return trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “My wife and i had a pleasant stay in Paris and in the hotel close to Sarbonnes university”
Reviews.Author: jschlabach
Reviews.Content: The room and the hospitality of the hotel was ok for aour purpose. We will come back soon and stay again in this hotel, because of the close location to the centre and the important places of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very welcoming, clean, well located and good value.”
Reviews.Author: modaffyduck
Reviews.Content: We arrived early from Eurostar, it was very easy to get there from the Gare de Nord, just three stops on the RER. Staff were extremely welcoming and although our rooms were not ready we were helped with our bags into a secure place and we were quite happy to go off and get lunch, picnic from the lovely little market at Place Maubert, eaten in the Luxembourg Gardens. We checked in and found our rooms were charming, very clean with good quality linen and towels and with a lovely view over the place Sorbonne. Breakfast was very good, quickly served from a hatch below the counter where orange juice, good coffee, croissants and many other pastries, ham and cheese etc, etc were constantly replenished. We were lucky and found a table for 4 free as it did get crowded and people were waiting to find a table as we left. Get up early! Staff at desk were very charming, for Parisiennes!, particularly Katherine. Who helped us with directions to restaurants and taxis. She was sweet. Really enjoyed our stay, nice place.

Reviews.Title: “A very good Week End”
Reviews.Author: MV3544
Reviews.Content: Very well located, of course. Very nice and spacious rooms (both Standard & Luxe), well decorated.. Staff very kind. Nice TV room, libray and hall. Only 2 details : no place to hang the towels in the bathroom, and the (nice) room for breakfast perhaps to smallSo, during the short time slot when a lot of people sant to have breakfast at the same time, you may have to wait a little (this was the case for us). A littlme bit disappointing for this kind of hotel, an upper class one.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, central and yet quiet”
Reviews.Author: BandBSavoie
Reviews.Content: The rooms are pleasant, nicely decorated, beds are comfortable. Weak point: breakfast which leaves a lot to be desired, the offer is fairly limited.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: cassandra_dorrington
Reviews.Content: The location was superb. Within walking distance to the Metro for easy access to and from the airport and to the tourist attractions.Close proximity to a number of bars and restaurant for evening entertainment. The hotel room while small was very well appointed and a great use of space. The complimentary breakfast in the morning was a great way to begin the day. The staff was very pleasant and despite the language barrier, they made every attempt to accommodate pour needs. On our last day, we came in after a full day of sightseeing to discover that the room was not made up. Upon calling the front desk, they immediately offered to move us to another room. There were all about service and ensuring our stay was comfortable. Definitely we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: MsLisb
Reviews.Content: You are here in the middel of everything, very easy to get around both day and night.. The hotel is very nice and the staff is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “surprise”
Reviews.Author: BlancaBrasil
Reviews.Content: first time I stayed near Sorbonne, it´s place is perfect! I really think this is an amazing hotel boutique with a lovely staff, nothing to complain!

Reviews.Title: “really great find....”
Reviews.Author: CavKA
Reviews.Content: I really am fond of this hotel. I first stayed here a number of years ago when I was lecturing during the summer in Paris; it was close to the venue and I picked it really because of that. But it grew on me for a lot of reasons. It is in the perfect location, near to RER stations if you are going to either airport, it is quite near the Latin Quarter and central to go to any of the major tourist stops. It is also incredibly friendly and despite the fact that hotel space in Paris is quite..well economical (read small), the design makes incredibly good use of the space. So for the particulars, this hotel is located on Place de la Sorbonne, which is near the Pantheon and the Sorbonne as well as Paris II (two big Universities in Paris). The closest RER stop or metro is Luxembourg. When you get off there, walk up Blvd St Michel and you are there in about 5-8 minutes. When you enter the hotel the first thing that will strike you is a fairly sleek design. The lobby has been renovated and is quite nice. There is a small bar and a few seating areas, one of which has a communal tv. The lobby area has wi-fi and it is free. There is not really wi-fi in the rooms but mine (room 74) had it if you sat closer to the door. I booked a single and not sure if they gave me one as it could easily have accommodate 2 people. The bed was a bit bigger than a queen size and whilst there was not much room around the bed, again the hotel design made efficient use of space, so there was storage space on both sides of the bed, an in room safe, a flat screen tv and even a small desk. The bathroom had door that opened a bit like a cupboard so I suppose that might not be great if you are sharing and want a bit of privacy but there was a good shower and again, even the bathroom, although small was well kitted out. breakfast is included in all the rates and is nothing special--cereals, lots of bread choices, croissant, small sweet rolls as well as cheese, yoghurt and fruit. For me, it was perfect but for others looking for a hot breakfast, maybe not so great. Still the breakfast area downstairs is quite nice and I really never have been there when you had to wait. I think this is a great choice for Paris!

Reviews.Title: “I'm the black sheep of reviewers”
Reviews.Author: Weeping_Tree
Reviews.Content: I was e-mailed a survey after staying here in late January 2011 so I'm just going to cut and paste. Pro's: Great location. Nice Lobby. Unique Dining Space. Cons: No Wi-Fi in the rooms. For this sole reason I will not be staying at this location again. Concierge should have explained where to use Wi-Fi (you can in the lobby but are screwed downstairs in the dining/lounge area)... the hours and offerings of their limited breakfast. It would have been nice to be advised of some alternatives to go for breakfast in the neighborhood, should I have desired an expanded selection (toast/cereal/juice/coffee is not really breakfast).... All of the cafe's I checked out did not open until 8 AM. Elevator is literally for one person and a piece of luggage. If there are two of you, no matter your size, you will be able to tell what kind of toothpaste they use. Very claustrophobic. Once exiting the elevator you are literally two steps from your door. At least where I stayed (4th floor/Room 79) there were only two rooms on the floor. Again, this adds to the feeling of claustrophobia. The view from the room window looked into a courtyard. No direct sunlight, no view, not bad, but nothing to look at either. The room was very, very tight. Unequivocally good for one person only (and though I'm tall, I'm slim... No fatty American here :)) Couldn't imagine having a co-worker or even my girlfriend along. I would have raised the issue if one had been traveling with me. No partition in the shower. For the life of me I cannot understand why this is customary in France. Water sprays everywhere!!! I spent 10 mins drying everything off. What's possibly worse??? ... Having a shower hose that is meant for short(er) people. I'm 6' 3" and the bloody hose only went up to my shoulder. There was no hinge to rest it on so not only did I feel like a monkey cleaning, I also felt like an acrobat in there. Hence water spraying everywhere. I'm not a clutz nor ignorant of a country's customs but come-on, really??? Lastly, I got screwed by the taxi driver on the way to the airport from the Hotel. I was placed into a cab that had been waiting for 10 mins for another guest. The meter was at 18 Euro within 2 mins after leaving the hotel (I didn't check it as soon as I entered.) I confronted the driver who said he didn't speak English but said something along the lines that "this was customary".... "from Dispatch" ??!!!. I obviously know this wasn't the case but had no option to abort the drive. I was running late and couldn't afford to risk finding another cab, let alone get into a huge argument with someone who claims to speak no English. That ride cost me 70 Euro's. I even tipped the bast*rd as I am one of "those" types.... He got me there safe and sound but totally screwed me in the process. This stay review was no reflection on this particular stay in France from me. I had a great time and some killer meetings. What pains me most is I had a pretty open budget, modest but open. I blame myself for not doing additional research. My first fail using Trip Advisor reviews. Sigh....

Reviews.Title: “Great room, modern fixtures, very easy location.”
Reviews.Author: Ross_Dunn
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a junior suite as there was three if us, so it did cost alittle more. St germain is a great location and would recommend the area no matter which hotel you stay in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean with great service!”
Reviews.Author: ambiguld
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant 5 night stay in Paris at this hotel. The location is fantastic and the hotel was in a nice condition. We had two big double rooms, one faced to the back and one to the Place Sorbonne. We didn't notice any noise from other guests or the restaurants on the Place, although if the windows were opened, the fountains were quite loud (They turn off at 10PM though, so you can leaved the windows open at night). The staff was very helpful with giving directions to parking, restaurants and sights. We had some problems with very curious neighbors who enjoyed leaning out of their window to get a view of us young girls in our room, but it took the staff less than 5 minutes to see them out of the hotel once we contaced the front desk. Only downside to the hotel is the breakfast. The staff worked the buffet very slowly and the room was stuffed with waiting guests due to a limited number of tables.

Reviews.Title: “This was a perfect hotel in the center of Paris for a couple of days”
Reviews.Author: Jaepetto
Reviews.Content: This was a perfect hotel in the center of Paris for a couple of days. The location is perfect and people were really firendly.

Reviews.Title: “A little jewel in the heart of Quartier Latin!”
Reviews.Author: geeko30
Reviews.Content: Always a pleasure to come back with fond and unforgettable memories. Simply a lovely hotel well located within the center of Quartier Latin and nice accomodating staff to make every stay an enjoyable one. Tidy room. Recommend the Superior room for a bigger washroom. Practical to have an elevator within the hotel. Easy access to public transportation and closeby to many city attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Paris, but Hotel was disappointing - location was good”
Reviews.Author: wande23412
Reviews.Content: We had booked and paid for an Executive Room, but it was extremely cramped (Room 14), had hardly any storage space for a minimum amount of clothing. The bath could only be filled by holding on to the lever which alternated the bath and shower. If you did not hold onto the lever, only the shower worked. Toilet paper was not replaced in the morning. Breakfast was very disappointing- tinned fruit salad. For the cost that we had paid, I would have expected a better appointed room.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel, friendly staff, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: fussypersonEngland
Reviews.Content: Rooms are fairly small. Showers are over bath and not full height, Would be better if full height showers were installed instead of baths. No tea or coffee making facilities in room - this would add to comfort. Overall though a good hotel in an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: hrodkin
Reviews.Content: Very cozy hotel in a great location. Right across the street from the Sorbonne. Easy walking distance to so much.

Reviews.Title: “very good, would definitely recommend to others visiting paris for a short break”
Reviews.Author: fannyg
Reviews.Content: I specify for a short brake only, because I believe that Parisian hotels are way too expensive for what they have to offer, so If you're looking to stay for a longer stay go for something in an area in an outer "arrondissement" of Paris. The location , which is what this hotel is all about, couldn't be bettered. If what you're after is roaming and getting lost in the streets of Paris then this is the place for you. The rooms: we were given the key (no cards here, which I kinda like) to our room. That particular room was very very small, and I am not overweight, or tall either. Now I understand the comments from previous reviewers about (some) room sizes, which up to now thought were out of proportion. This particular room, had one more disadvantage: it's window overlooked the reception area and had no natural light coming on (or it seemed that way to us). All in all a very claustrophobic room. So we asked to change, to which they happily agreed to. After been shown one more similar room, we were shown to a room overlooking the side street, which had plenty of natural light coming in. Exposed wooden beams & stone on the ceiling and wall respectively are a nice touch. But that's what their photos "sell" anyway. The girl receptionist was very nice, and recommended 2 restaurants of which one was closed due to National Armistice day, and the other was a revelation! (read my other contribution). What I have learnt from using trip-advisor and also contributing as a reviewer, is that peoples' perception of a hotel is 9/10 times dependant on how good they're overall travelling experience was . For instance an O.K hotel on a brilliant overall trip becomes "the best hotel we've stayed in!! ever!!
