" and a very good hotel on a romantic trip gone wrong, becomes " the worst staffed hotel I have ever come across ..." or something across these lines. I am no better, when it comes to reviews. It seems that emotion gets the better of us, and we review accordingly. If I were to be accurate and non biased by my lovely trip, then i'd have to say that this hotel comes highly recommended, for couples, or friends visiting the beautiful city that's Paris. They could add a few slices of ham to their breakfast, but at a city where only a few hotels serve breakfast at no extra cost, croissants and cereal will do me fine!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in fantastic location - we'll definitely be staying again.”
Reviews.Author: Bunionboy
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a surprise weekend in Paris based on the Trip Advisor reviews and I was most impressed. After a warm welcome at reception we made our way to a superb 6th floor superior room. It had amazing views over the Place du Sorbonne and the City skyline beyond, and the room was compact but very well appointed with wet room and great lighting. We even had a chilled bottle of champagne waiting as requested. The hotel is in a great location, yet remains a quiet a place to relax. Nearby facilities and restaurants were good and the self service breakfast in the morning was better than most I have had in France previously. I would definitely stay again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Stylishly renovated rooms, extremely comfortable bed, great location.”
Reviews.Author: serabm
Reviews.Content: I stay in Paris all the time for work and fun, and like the area near the Sorbonne because it's so central. For awhile I have been staying at a different hotel in the area, after trying out about 10 others, but I decided to give this one a shot based on reviews, and I think I have a new favorite local hotel! Rooms are small and it's expensive, but that's central Paris. The room I had was really nicely designed, had a good work space, closet space, and bathroom. The bed was incredibly comfortable. My only two complaints were that it was a bit stuffy without the window open but then of course one gets street noise, and that there is no glass water guard in the bathtub for the shower, which I always find hard to deal with. Definitely not a deal breaker but something they could easily change.

Reviews.Title: “Could it be better?”
Reviews.Author: nsppsp
Reviews.Content: location: second to none - in the heart of Paris and quiet staff: competent - professionnal - friendly - always ready to help and find a solution to which ever problem you have decoration: styly - reflects the spirit of the owner and his research in making a difference rooms: those overlooking the square are a dream breakfast: improving from year to year Many thanks to Laure, Marie-Hélène, Laurent, Nordin and Idris for making my stay so agreable

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant, quiet and modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1st_timer_10
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip ever to Paris. I was going for business, therefore everything was booked by my company's travel department. Apparently we have had not a great experience with hotels in Paris previously so my colleague wasn't too sure about this one either. I am sure now that I have given her my feedback, we will be using this lovely place in the future. It is also conveniently located with a few metro stations nearby, max 5mins walk! Really pleasant stay. I would say it was too hot at nightime, but maybe it was down to me and not checking the A/C! Really nice staff and a nice variety of food for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in nice part of town.”
Reviews.Author: Leo036
Reviews.Content: Comfortable hotel in charming area, some ten minutes walk away from Seine and close to lovely Jardin du Luxenbourg. Friendly staff who, via e-mail, arranged so that we got our two rooms close to each other, and also made a reservation at a nice restaurang in advance. Pretty good breakfast (not only coffee and croissants) although the breakfast room was a bit crowded when all guests showed up at the same time. Perhaps not the right choice if you're used to luxury hotels, but for the rest of us, this is a fair place to stay a couple of nights.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent small hotel, if a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: MikeBHaywardsHeath
Reviews.Content: Small hotel, approx 40 rooms over 6 floors. Rooms on the small side but typical of Paris. Friendly, helpful staff; all those on front desk spoke good English. Breakfasts very good.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and beautifully designed little hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Gunilla63
Reviews.Content: Modern and nicely designed, yet cozy, hotel in an excellent location. Was much better than I expected from the website. Very nice and helpful staff at all times. Room fairly small but very comfortable. I stayed in a superior room and the colors (brown, beige, black, white) and lights gave it a sophisticated feel. Comfortable bed with lots of pillows. Beautiful french windows facing Place de la Sorbonne. Well isolated = quiet. Bathroom with bathtub and separate toilet. Perfectly clean. Lobby, lounge and bar relaxing and nicely designed w free WiFi. Charming breakfast room in the basement. Somewhat limited breakfast buffet, but totally OK. Cafés and restaurants right next to the hotel. Can definitely recommend this hotel - especially to business travelers and couples/friends.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: baron54
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in Latin Quarter close to RER and Metro. Walking distance to Notre Dame, Louvre, and many restaurants,cafes, and bars. Two restaurants next door to hotel, but did not eat in either. Standard rooms are very small, and shower is handheld type in bathtub without shower stall/curtain. Somewhat awkward and messy. Not many conveniences, air conditioning (if there is any!) was terrible. Needed to have windows open to cool down room. Bed and pillows were OK and we slept well. Continental breakfast adequate with cereal, bread, pastries, fruit and cheese. Elevator fits two people, if you do not have too much luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location spoilt by a cramped room”
Reviews.Author: djh1986
Reviews.Content: I booked the Select Hotel in Paris based on it's central location on the Left Bank and reviews on TA. The location couldn't be faulted, positioned between two very busy Metro stations (five mins walk to each) and situated on a gorgeous Parisian square with cafes and fountains. As there were three of us going, we decided to book a triple room which was a fairly pricey expense but we thought it'd be worth it looking at official hotel photos and rooms. When we arrived late at night, we were situated on the ground floor in what was basically a small double room with a small sofa bed at the side of the room. It was very disappointing for the money we had paid and on top of this, the window of the room didn't open making it very hot and stuffy with three adults in the room. The breakfast was average and the service at reception was sluggish. Otherwise, the hotel was clean and bright but the room was very disappointing. I may give the hotel another chance in a double room when I next return to Paris as the location is faultless but I thought we overpaid for what we were given.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent but Needs Aircondition”
Reviews.Author: stollyboy
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel and the service could not have been better with the very helpful Laurent and Arnau. Our only complaint was it was very hot. The aircondion was already turned off for the seadon and we had difficulty sleeping even with the windows open which made it a bit noisy. The free wi-fi at the lobby was great but could not stay too long as I was seating.

Reviews.Title: “What you see is what you get...the photos matched the experience.”
Reviews.Author: SandersonHenry
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very good location. Very helpful and friendly staff. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: deestruction
Reviews.Content: We were on the 6th Floor overlooking the Sorbonne in a stunning modern room. We had a fabulous bathroom with a huge walk in shower and seperate toilet. Room had a safe and 2 tellies (one in the mirror in the bathroom!!). Staff were friendly and helpful. The only let down was the fact that we could not use the air conditioning as this had been switched off by the hotel - perhaps they weren't expecting temps in the early 20's in Oct! As a result we had to sleep with the window's open - not a problem on our first night but Saturday night was"nuit blanche", and boy did those Parisians party! The hotel is very central and everything was easily walkable. Breakfast basic, but good enough to set you up for the day. Would definitely stay here again, but again would go for the upgrade to a superior room.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel bit cramped but ok”
Reviews.Author: neil186530
Reviews.Content: the hotel was very nice room was not very big if there was two of use it would have been a squeeze same with bath room the stairs up to the room if the lift had not been working there would not have been room for suit case the are round hotel wasvery nice and it was very handie for the center of paris

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: teaeagle
Reviews.Content: The upside and main reason for staying here is the location, its walking distance to Notre Dame and the Musee d'Orsay (about 15 mins) and easily accessed by RER and Metro. Our room was clean and small and reasonably quiet (although we were lucky to be on the side of the hotel and in a room not immeadiately adjacent to any others, we could hear some niose from rooms above and below). The main downside I think was the tempreture - our small room was stuffy and warm at night, the air consitioning is centrally controlled so we couldn't turn it on and the windows do open but make it nioisy which is fine in the day time but not at night. The breakfast room is alos really overheated, a little bit like eating in a sauna. If it's location you're after this place would be hard to beat, if you are after a longer, more comfotrable stay you might want to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: maylo19
Reviews.Content: Within 10 min walk from St-Michel RER station and La Seine. We stayed for 9 days at this hotel and we felt very welcome. The personnel is devoted, the hotel is clean and the location is perfect. The rooms are not big but this is Paris... (just watch out for the rooms on the sixth floor).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Katyhack
Reviews.Content: I found the staff at the desk very personable and helpful. I chose this for its location in the Latin Quarter and was not disappointed. The hotel was very nice and breakfast was a standard continental breakfast. Not only is the hotel in walking distance to most of the wonders of the Rive Gauche but there are also 3 cafes downstairs to choose from if you are tired and do not wish to have room service or go searching for a restaurant. I reccomend buying a sandwich and walking up the street 5 minutes to eat in the beautiful Jardin de Luxembourg which is so close! Great location, great rooms and a pleasant staff!

Reviews.Title: “Far better than most 3 star hotels and with a great location!”
Reviews.Author: MarionMontgomery
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an ideal location and we had booked for 2 nights in September Getting to the hotel from Gare du Nord could entail a trip on the RER but we got a Paris cab, an air conditioned Mercedes no less for 9Euros, so take your pick which mode of transport you fancy ! Some have said in their reviews “gorgeous and amazing”…I certainly wouldn’t go that far in praising it but it is certainly an excellent 3 star in a great location, the hotel is as many have said extremely well located. On our arrival the reception was courteous and professional. We couldn’t check in until 3pm, the last inhabitants having left late…no problem as there are bars and cafes directly outside. When we got our key we weren’t shown to the room just directed – no problem with that but we did struggle in their tiny lift (elevator), 1 man and 1 bag was all it would take. There was access via a spiral staircase which was OK for us as our room was on the 1st floor facing the square and as anticipated was “compact” but well designed. It was extremely clean and well maintained. The double glazing was superb – when the windows -which had bench seats set in the bays –were open you got all the buzz from the people below and students entering the adjacent Sorbonne…but close them a total silence…amazing! The air con in the room was on as we had great weather but there was just a gentle “hummmmmm”….and it kept the room cool perfectly. Breakfast was in the vaulted basement. It was OK… very basic and simple and cafeteria style…you got a plastic try, helped yourself to OK coffee, croissant and pastries with the usual pre-packed jams etc a typical “continental breakfast” a la service stations on the auto routes…its included in the room rate. Down side – the orange juice was “squash” , concentrate with water added ( I saw them preparing it)…pity! The room was extremely well prepared for our 2nd day – all credit to whoever does this. If you want a place to eat within easy walking distance then please visit La Maison du Jardin near the Senate at Jardin Luxembourg. It is both superb quality and value…but you MUST book, its always full! We got a cab from the hotel back to the Eurostar at Gare du Nord and it again only cost 9 Euros – great value. So all in all for a 3 star hotel it was indeed at the top of the tree but alas it was also at the top end of its standards pricing. Would we go again? Yes we would and we would recommend others to do so.

Reviews.Title: “A perfectly located hotel next to Luxembourg Gardens and 2 minutes from the RER Metro”
Reviews.Author: Hobbes222
Reviews.Content: Excellent rooms and friendly staff... freshly prepared breakfast in comfortable dining room. Quality Cafe and Restaurant next door... All located next to the peaceful Jardin du Luxembourg and 2 minutes walk from the Metro to connect to the Airport. The Latin Quarter on your doorstep ... what more could you ask for ??

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: marion5501
Reviews.Content: The rooms are definitely a little small, but very chic. The hotel is in a great location and the staff couldn't be nicer.

Reviews.Title: “loves it”
Reviews.Author: HR_london_10
Reviews.Content: Would strongly recommend - gorgeous hotel, fabulous location we walked everywhere really easily, overlooks beautiful Place de la Sorbonne with few nice cafes etc. Inside hotel spotlessly clean, very friendly reception staff, made great restaurant recommendations and did all our bookings etc, room service etc all lovely. Rooms are not huge and breakfast fairly basic / continental but for the money you cant really complain.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, price and service!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sindart
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a triple room (4th floor) and it was a lot bigger than I expected by Paris standards. It was also very clean and the staff was very helpful in every aspect. The spoke English well so that was a plus. Continental breakfast was included so that too was a plus. The elevator was small only 2 people and a stroller fit at any one time but not a problem since stairs were a good source of exercise. I would definitely come back and recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice for a stay in Paris! Good location, nice and clean and quiet!”
Reviews.Author: Bengan_19
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Select Hotel Rive Gauche from Thursday untill sunday and had a great time. The Hotel is located near Sorbonne and 2.min walk from Pantheon, The people that worked at the hotel speak english and were very helpfull. Good breakfast with great Croissant and jam. Happy to stay her again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location, room a little small but typical of Paris sizes”
Reviews.Author: switzer570
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March 2009 for 2 nights, it is situated overlooking a small square and has a nice cafe next door, we never acyually got to eat at the hotel as we were very busy sightseeing and were too tired to get up for breakfast. The rooms are well set out, very clean and quiet. We slept very well there as the beds were very comfy and in a room that is nicely decorated. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The only thing that would be a down side is the size of the lift is very small which didn't bother us as we used the stairs most of the time but it is big enough for 2 people with suitcases at a squeeze if needed. This is quite a small hotel but is decorated as a grand hotel and tries to keep this feeling in every way including service and comfort, it does this with success. On previous years I have been dissapointed on trips away on other holidays but this place gave me back my confidence in accommodation whilst staying away from home. Please give this hotel a try if you dont mind stairs or a small lift as it is a little gem in a great location. If I ever go back to Paris I wouldn't consider staying anywhere else as my stay here was so relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Out of this world !!”
Reviews.Author: ellyreynolds
Reviews.Content: We found the Select Hotel to be everything we could have ever wanted. The Staff were helpful friendly and couldn’t do enough to help. The location was perfect right outside of the Sorbonne in a lovely square with fountains and a few restaurants, lovely to sit and look out upon the square but always quiet at night. The hotel was very clean, tastefully decorated modern but in keeping with the setting. Food very good could not fault in anyway. The hotel is also perfectly located for the Metro and would advise any visitors coming on the EuroStar to use the St Michel Stop from main station

Reviews.Title: “Select "Select" for Location, Comfort and Style”
Reviews.Author: lexavia
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Select once again confirmed why it is my residence of choice in Paris. Located in the stylish and tranquil Place de la Sorbonne, and convenient to Metro and RER stations, as well as to the restaurant district of the Left Bank, the Hotel Select provides modern and comfortable accommodation at reasonable prices. I did notice that the carpet on the staircase and in the halls was showing signs of wear and tear when compared when my previous vists to the hotel, and could do with replacement. And I do wish that the hotel would provide a fitting higher up on the wall of the bathtub on which to attach the shower head, so that guests may enjoy a standing, "hands free" shower. Otherwise, everything was fabulous !

Reviews.Title: “nicely modernised hotel in excellent position”
Reviews.Author: John186220
Reviews.Content: excellent position, well modernised good quality furnishings and good service. Rooms fronting the square particularly nice , albeit with some noise from outside including sound of the fountains. Rooms in rear extension not so nice with very narrow/small staircase and lift and view onto light well.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: GT33
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in an ideal location. Just minutes from the RER Luxembourg station, this is ideal for any visitors arriving from CDG. The Hotel staff were very welcoming and we found our room to be just about right. Comfy beds, ample storage and clean throughout. Only gripe was the soundproofing from adjacent rooms, particularly on the 2nd floor.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, so much more than expected!”
Reviews.Author: QueenieRoadie
Reviews.Content: Imagined we would get a fairly bog standard hotel for the price we had paid, but we were very pleasantly surprised. I travelled with my teenage daughter and wanted somewhere where we could feel safe and that was close to all that there is to see in Paris! This hotel was perfect, easy to get to Gare de Nord to Luxembourg and then a 5 minute stroll. Off the main road in a lovely square just in front of La Sorbonne. So clean, and for a city hotel the room was 'ample' . Breakfast was good allowing us to choose what we wanted from the continental buffet and the staff were discreet but helpful. Only downside was the noisy spoilt American in the room next to us - could do with a little more soundproofing so that we didn't have to hear her complaining (about life in general)!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: EJM1
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay in this lovely hotel. Great location, lovely decor, comfy bed ,very clean and great service. I would say that the bathroom was part of the main bedroom and did not have a separate door, although the toilet did. Fine for couples but not so great for friends sharing. That said, I would recommend this hotel to anyone as I though it was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place to stay a few days”
Reviews.Author: Robi50
Reviews.Content: It's a hotel in the heart of Paris (Place de la Sorbonne) but really quiet at night if your room is located arround the atrium. Standard rooms are small but nice. You should be familliar with the person you share the room with, the bathroom can not be closed (toilet has a door).Breakfast was included and good, coffee, tea, hot milk,orange juice, jam, fruit salad, cheese, two sorts of bread, croissants are presented in a very modern and stylish cellar room. Service was very friendly. The bar is not very good equipped with good glases of wine, only wine in (0,7l) bottles seems to be of an acceptable level. The both restaurants beneath the hotel are quite expensive, the one near the bar tabac (not tested) is of bad quality too, bad salad, bad coctails, cruel toilets, unmotivated service.

Reviews.Title: “Warning- security breach alert!”
Reviews.Author: sej
Reviews.Content: Just returned from France and thought I'd warn everyone about the total lack of security at the Select Hotel in Paris. We arrived very early in the morning so we left our bags at the hotel and spent the day wandering around the city. Later that afternoon we returned to the hotel to check in and take a short break. I decided to lay down for a bit when I heard a quick knock on the door and before I could even answer, a man unlocked the door and came into my room! I quickly got up- luckily I hadn't gotten undressed- and when he saw how startled I was he went to the phone and made some excuse about how someone had reported the phone not working. He then said the phone was working and that it must have been another room. When my friend and I got together for dinner she said he'd done the same thing to her. We decided to report the incident, but the young man manning the front desk, though very courteous and friendly, said we'd have to wait and report it to the day shift. Luckily there was a chair in the room that I was able to jam up against the door since I wouldn't have been able to sleep otherwise (the door only had one lock, not the extra security lock the hotels have here). The next day I put the no disturb sign on my door since I didn't need the room cleaned and locked up my laptop in my bag. When we returned to the hotel that afternoon I found my door unlocked! My friend's was unlocked as well. Had we been staying longer (just stayed three nights) we would have moved to another hotel. On the train going out from Paris to our next destination I started getting a headache and guess what- the baggie with my medicines was missing! I didn't even have prescription meds- just the usual traveling stuff. Needless to say, even though the location is great and the staff friendly, I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone. One last note- it's easy for someone to go unnoticed in the rooms because of the chopped up interior configuration of the hotel. This makes it private, but private as well for someone who wants to loot the place.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Oli58_10
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel in the heart of Paris. Stayed in Tripel room. Room was not big but enough for us (small but cosy). Bathroom clean and modern with bathtub and shower head but no shower curtain or shower head bracket. Free wi-fi internet in the lobby. Few minuets walk from all the resturants and bars in the Latin Quarters. Enjoyed our stay in this hotel. Staff very friendly and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Superb central located city hotel with small but modern and beautifull renovated rooms!!”
Reviews.Author: Pauljess
Reviews.Content: Select Hotel is small but good designed hotel with beautiful renovated and modern rooms. Not to big but everything you will need is there. If you need space, book an Suite!! The sixt floor (highest) is getting renovated on the moment. The rainshower in the standard rooms (also find in some other types) are heavenly!! They have also rooms with long beds (just ask for it). We have slept very good in it. (but that is personal). Not only the lobby but also the rooms were very nice decorated, what makes the sice of it not really an issue! The breakfastroom is small, but has enough places to sit. Only the breakfastbuffet/corner was to small. You could hardly turn your back and have to wait uppon the person in front of you. French breakfast are different than for example Dutch breakfasts, but nevertheless, everything (exept the orangejuice) was fresh!!! Croissants, bread, yoghurt, Coffee, thea. They did not have meat, only cheese and jam and so on. The location of this hotel is superb!!!! A little stroll will bring you to Jardin du Luxembourgh, the Pantheon, the Louvre, Notredame and the Marais, if you will take the bus or subway there is a busstop on both side of the street (Blv St. Michel) about 200 mtrs from the hotel and 1 RER metro stop 'Luxembourg' on about 500 mtrs and 1 metro stop 'Cluny la Sorbonne' about 400 mtrs from the hotel. Right next to the hotel you will find University Sorbonne and 3 bars where you can eat and drink. On about 500 mtrs you will find 3 streets full with restaurants/bars. Also in Jardin du Luxembourg (which is close to the hotel) you will find a nice little brasserie!! At last but not least the staff of the hotel is super friendly and helpfull with anything you will ask! They can book all kinds of excursions etc. Just ask! Some other suggestions: For lunch buy some sandwiches and drinks and go to one of the many parks in the city and have a picknick! (thake towel or sarong with you to sit on). In the summerweekends you will find a Jazzfestival in Le Parc Floral just at the back of Chateau Vincennes, which is easily reached by metro!! (east of Paris). It only cost around 5 euro pp and take your picknickstuff with you!!! There is also a restaurant. Have a great stay in Paris, a real romantic and buzzy city!

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: MontyFriendsAbroad
Reviews.Content: Good value, comfortable hotel, with air-conditioned and many quiet rooms. The buffet breakfast was good for this type of hotel in France and included a selection of cereals, bread, pastries and unfortunately tinned fruit. Staff were friendly and helpful and location of the hotel is excellent, with access to both the more expensive but tourist focused restaurant/bar areas or the less expensive more local/authentic places. The one negative for some might be the open bathrooms with the exception of the toilet.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: Dude15
Reviews.Content: My son and I enjoy the hotel. The staff was extremely polite and very helpful. I heard things about the French people but I will say I did not encounter that at all. Everyone from the front desk to cleaning people were really polite. Next time I'm in Paris I will be staying at the Rive-Gauche.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent on all aspects: location, location, location; clean; great breakfast; wonderful and helpful personnel”
Reviews.Author: plevine47
Reviews.Content: You can not find a hotel with a better location: in its own plaza with cafes, water fountains, and the stunning front to Le Sorbonne! Given the fine service and then some, it is hard to ask for anything more.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, modern & clean rooms!!”
Reviews.Author: Carlos006
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a fantastic spot in the Latin Quarters - near everything you would need to visit Paris and there are 3 cafes right outside the door and tons of restaurants in a more touristy street just five minutes walk from the hotel. It is just a perfect location for either the business or leisure traveler (we were doing both). Walking distance to the island, the Notre Dame cathedral, Luxemburg park, the RER transit and 2 metro stations (learn how to use it, very easy and you can get around Paris traffic at a very low cost and very effeciently - we did not take a single cab around the city!). The staff at the hotel are just awosome, fantastic, friendly, funny and helpful - THANK YOU MARIE HELENE!!!! They were so accomodating and even switched our rooms twice in order to ensure my wife's sister would have a place to stay for the 2 nights she visited us from the UK. They kept our original room to move us back to - THANK YOU!!! This has become our hotel of choice when visiting Paris and will not stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Magical: incomparable blend of beautiful decor and matchless service”
Reviews.Author: susanandbucky
Reviews.Content: The imaginative, contemporary decor is beautiful and welcoming in both the guest rooms and reception areas. The breakfast room downstairs is charming. The hotel location is splendid, in the heart of the Latin Quarter facing the Sorbonne, with easy access to public transportation . The pedestrian square offers several lively bistros, yet the rooms are quiet at night. The staff are exceptionally helpful, making suggestions that saved us a lot of time and trouble. We stumbled on the Select - Rive Gauche by accident but could not have planned it better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: xiaomizi
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Select Hotel for a week in July. The location is excellent.RER B line from airport CDG is a ride about 45 minutes. You may get off RER from either Luxembourg or St. Michel, but I prefer Luxembourg, because the station is for RER B only. St Michel is a big station, many metro connections there, it's much more crowded. Both stations are about 5 minutes walk to the hotel. The hotel is sitting at the corner of a lovely plaza in front of Sorbonne University, only a few steps away from busy St. Michel Blvd, but really quiet. There are many excellent restaurants nearby, Quartier Latin and St. Germain, plenty choices. Metro and bus stops are all within a few minutes walk. I was given the room on the top floor, room 82. It is a typical Paris hotel room, small but very clean. The bed is very comfortable. The bathroom is small too, but not worse than any other small hotels I stayed in Paris. My only problem with the room is the natural lighting. The only window for the room is not big, and near the entrance of the room. It is facing an inside courtyard,.So the room is quiet, but does not have too much natural lighting and almost no view (there is a plant in the window box, maybe tries to give some privacy, but blocks the lighting as well) Even during the day, I have to have the lights on if I am in the room. The breakfast is simply, but enough for someone like me, who is not an egg & meat eater for breakfast. It is typical Paris cafe breakfast, juice, coffee, toast, pastry. There are cereal, yogurt and fruit salad as well. The staff are very friendly and nice, all speak English well. Indeed, their English are so good it makes me embarrassing to practice my French:) The free Wi-Fi in the lobby is great. I don't bring a laptop, but with my iPhone, connecting to the Wi-Fi saves me a lot from my AT&T bill. Overall, I would say it is a very nice stay. But the best of all is the location of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good value, great location, friendly (for Paris standards), maybe a boost in breakfast would be good!”
Reviews.Author: EDLU
Reviews.Content: Within a 10 minute walk from the Seine and Notre Dame, the hotel is ideally located if you want to see another side of Paris. Metro and RER (regional trains) are within reach, and the next door Sorbonne Univeristy keeps the neighborhood live at any time. Rooms could be more spacious but are well designed so you don't feel claustrophobic. No minibar in mine. Breakfast offers the very basic, no espresso, two cereals, one kind of bread and cheese, could use a little expansion. The lobby is flooded with light and it's nice to hang out in its living room while waiting or browsing the web. Right on the airport train line so it's extremely easy and fast to get there as soon as you land.

Reviews.Title: “great for a short break in paris”
Reviews.Author: ginnydorset
Reviews.Content: this is a perfect hotel if you want to stay on the left bank and experience a more ethnic version of paris than you get on the other side of the river. we stayed 2 nights at the hotel. It was a perfect location as we wanted to go to hear the organ at St Sulpice on Sunday morning. We loved the atmosphere of the small square outside the hotel, right in front of the Sorbonne, with a few lively cafes and fountains and magnolia trees in bloom. The hotel is handy for the metro and well placed for visiting Notre dame, and the river, Louvre and Rodin museum (all of which we walked to). The rooms are modern and stylish but the shower didn't work so we had to use the bath. Breakfast was ok but perhaps I'd have preferred just to gom out to a cafe. Hotel staff very helpful. Would definitely recommend and use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Paris is a marvelous city and the accommodations at the Select were very nice.”
Reviews.Author: elizabeth_loew
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Select is situated perfectly in the Latin Quarter of Paris. The people that work there are very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Four nights in the shadow of the Sorbonne”
Reviews.Author: Petherwin
Reviews.Content: Housekeeping, Reception and Breakfast Room service were all excellent. The breakfasts themselves offered a good range of fresh items, though a juice other than orange (e.g. grapefruit) would have been welcome. The room decor was extremely attractive - as was the whole hotel - but there was very little room between the bed and the bathroom doors. There was also very litle space to put folded clothes (in other words, no drawers or usable shelves). This was Room 21. The location was superb, close to RER, Jardins du Luxembourg, fountains and bars just outside, in the shadow of the handsome Sorbonne building. Although La Place de la Sorbonne is busy and quite noisy, our room - at the back of the hotel - was delighfully peaceful. Best: location. Least: lack of space in bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Whilst this hotel fronts onto the most...”
Reviews.Author: Skipitydoda
Reviews.Content: Whilst this hotel fronts onto the most beautiful square in one of the most desirable areas in Paris, the price reflects this. The rooms are on the small side, although about what you would expect for a city hotel. They are well appointed although a facility to make a coffee in the room would be a welcome addition. The square to the front of the hotel is a busy, picturesque area with fountains and restaurants although don't think that you will be disturbed by noise. Our room was on the first floor directly above the square and once the double glazed windows are shut, you wouldn't hear a thing. Breakfast is a self service affair with orange juice, coffee, cereal, pastries and bread to toast. It is adequate even though it is complimentary. Transport from Charles de Gaulle airport is simple. Take the RER to Paris (around 9 euro) and get off at Luxenbourg Station. It's only a 2 or 3 minute walk from there. Walk down to Notre Dame (about a 10 minute stroll) through the fabulous cobbled streets lined with bars and cafes. Endless choice of where to eat or drink. Probably one of the best hotels in the area. Seen plenty nearby where I would run a mile before staying. You do pay a premium for it. If you don't mind paying, then I would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel with excellent accommodation”
Reviews.Author: BurySusieQ
Reviews.Content: Located next door to the Sorbonne on a pretty square with 3 - 4 bars and restaurants. Ideal for visiting the Latin quarter but close enough to walk to Notre Dame and the Louvre also handy for Buses and the Metro. The continental breakfast offers a good selection and there is a small friendly licensed bar, the staff are exrtremely helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible hotel! Amazing stay!”
Reviews.Author: Dara123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on the place de la sorbonne, right in the middle of a little courtyard with a fountain, shops, and three cafes/restaurants. It's located in the St. Germain area, which is the best place to stay. There's food, shopping, and tons of great things nearby, all within walking distance. Notre Dame is about a 5 minute walk, as is the river, and at night it makes for a great place to walk around. The nearest metro station would be the St. Michel stop. The room was small, but great regardless. They gave you soaps, hairdryer, everything except shampoo and conditioner, so bring that with you. There's a monoprix (supermarket/conveneint store) located down the block on St. Germain st as well as a larger one across the street on the left side which is open until 11:30 at night in case you need anything. (it's a great store). If I return to Paris I would DEFINITELY stay here again. I paid 140 Euros per night for the room, which included breakfast. I will be happy to answer any questions you may have about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best location, quality and cosiness you could dream of in 15 minutes walk from Notre Damme”
Reviews.Author: shms
Reviews.Content: I very much advise to take the room facing the Sobronne square. The view on the fountains, the University and the opposite houses is magnificent. The cafes on the square are very nice and in the one next to the hotel entrance the staff is really very friendly. The sound isolation in the rooms is very good. Breakfast is very simple as in many Paris hotels and as an alternative you can have it either right there on the square or in cafes that you will find on your way to Notre Damme (my favorite is Saint Michel).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - but too expensive”
Reviews.Author: KarstenSommer
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent and the superiour room was fine. The price is a bit high compared to prices in e.g. Copenhagen and the same quality of the room. Not always satisfactory level of informatin about sorroundings - e.g. Opera open or not? The bath is a joke. It's very difficult to have a shower. It is only intended for people who only wants a bath in the bath tub (think most people to day want to use the shower). Also the hand shower is very strange. I'll recommend the ower to have a shower and judge if this should be the standard in a 255 Euro room. As we booked the room 1 month before arrival and asked for a room on 4-6th floor, we were dissapointed only to have one at 1st floor.

Reviews.Title: “good location: next to University of Paris Sorbonne”
Reviews.Author: caitlans
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for five nights. The first night started off to a bad start. Arrived to "leave your bags and come back around 1:00pm. Your room is not ready" . Came back at 1:00pm to be met with " we have a problem and don't have a room for you but we have booked you with another hotel close by. Come back in the morning and we will have your upgraded room. " This other hotel was not half as nice, but they did upgrade us for the rest of our stay which was very nice. I would definately stay here again. It was right next to the University of Paris campus in the Latin Quarter. There were many places to eat within blocks of the hotel that were student hang outs and very affordable. Close to Notre Dame and the Rue Mouffetard market where we visited on Saturday morning and enjoyed many wonderful foods and sites. Metro was a couple of blocks away that was direct to Charles DeGauille airport on line B3. Hotel was very clean. Breakfast was continental: coffee, juice, breads , cheeses and cereal. This is the only meal served. Our room was quiet but overlooked the square with the fountains. They shut off the fountains at 9pm every night. Cafe right outside of the hotel had good food and generous serving sizes. The perfect place to sit and sip your cafe and enjoy good company. Wireless internet is free in the lobby but there is a fee to have it in your room. No shower in our room, only hand held for the bathtub. No shower curtain but with a towel on the floor to take up the extra water , you can make due. A very small elevator only big enough for two. TV in room gets three English speaking channels: BBC , CNBC, CNN. It was nice to keep up on the news. Air conditioning in room was nice. Beds were comfortable and plenty of pillows. Very contemporary decor done tastefully.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, friendly service and top location”
Reviews.Author: mer_fer
Reviews.Content: Clean, modern and delightfully decorated hotel in a perfect location. Our room was small but well appointed with very comfortable beds. Quiet and efficient air conditioning, a big window that opened onto a quiet lane. Spotlessly clean bathroom, brightly lit with plenty of hot water and thick newer towels. Basic but good petit dejeuner self serve in a cozy lower level dining area. The staff was friendly, helpful and responsive to all of our needs. Free wi-fi only in the lobby (the website said free wi-fi in the rooms) This hotel was perfect for our short stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful view to the place de la Sorbonne”
Reviews.Author: vdodsworth
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, good service, great location, good croissant at the breakfast, but...The bath tub was clogged and despite my complaint at the reception desk nothing was done.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: lmcnary
Reviews.Content: this was a great place to stay it it was within walking distance of almost everything. I especially appreciated the free wifi in the lobby since I had been traveling for a month before that with a tour group and was ready for a hotel with service. I arrived early and they cleaned the room immediately for me and before I could even ask they said if you have a computer you can just sit in the lobby couches and catch up on your emails if you'd like. The breakfast was actually pretty good for a european breakfast and they had the cab waiting for me half an hour before I even needed it. Great ending to my trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: britboi1978
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night on Friday 21st. The staff were bilingual and extremely helpful and friendly with all enquiries. The room was small, however the way that it was arranged was intelligent with great use of space. Modern facilities, albeit the lack of a shower curtain confused us but the overall quality of the room and bathroom are above most UK hotels. Breakfast was the typical continental breakfast with amazing coffee and plenty of pastries, yoghurt, toast etc. Breakfast is served in the vaulted cellar - if you are tall, you'll need to duck! Check in was smooth and none of this nonsense form filling that is mandatory around the world! The hotel is located on Place De la Sarbonne, a busy but peaceful square and within 10 minutes walking distance of Notre Dame and the river Seine. If you are looking for something unique with a designer spin, this is the hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Has Potential, Not Quite There Yet.”
Reviews.Author: MarkButt
Reviews.Content: Ultimately, this hotel has some potential. The location is an absolute must so if you aren't planning to be in your room and are not a business traveler, then this should be an option you consider. Second, the staff are bilingual and very helpful. Third, the lobby and design of the hotel is quite boutique which is nice. The wireless internet is free in the lobby and 10 Euro's a day ur something like 25E for the week. It has a good connection too. There are a few things that need help, however. First, the breakfast is marginal at best. Heavy carbs, of course, so don't expect much here - continental only. Second, They were doing a lot of construction above me which was VERY loud and caused drywall and dust to fall from the ceiling onto my bed. I'm pretty understanding in knowing that all hotels do have construction but I do feel like they have an obligation to customers to let them know prior to arrival or place them as far away as possible. It started at 8am, every morning... Additionally, my bathroom didn't have a door... that was not problematic as I was a business traveler solo, but could be for those of you who want privacy. There are traditional french bathrooms so there is no shower curtain ONLY baths. Additionally, there are no irons in the room - when I asked for one to be sent up, they said they only had one... and that I would have to use it in the lobby of the hotel! It was somewhat amusing that I was ironing my pants for business... in the lobby. Don't bring a lot of luggage, the elevators have room for just two bodies standing upright so be mindful of that. This is definitely for a casual traveler who isn't going to spend much time there. This has the potential to be a great boutique hotel, it's just not there quite yet.

Reviews.Title: “Top location but....”
Reviews.Author: CicciCh
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel on a top location, central but very quite at night. I don't understand why the hotel does not provide a curtain for the shower. It is such a simply and cheap solution to avoid a mess in the bathroom and a lot of irritation for the clients. Breakfast is a simple buffet, okay for a French hotel but don't expect too much. Coffee, milk, tea, yoghurt, cornflakes, butter, jam, cheese and different kinds of croissants and bread. I could consider going back to this hotel next time but as on our 2nd morning we discovered a huge cockroach crawling on the wall in the breakfast room I will definetely search for alternatives in the same area. It's a pity as the location and the hotel have a lot of potential.

Reviews.Title: “It is a great place to be in Paris with friendly,professional and helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: Antoinette-Marie
Reviews.Content: We enjoy our stay, we loved the location, walking distance to Louvre and more. We appreciated the helpful staff, smiley, eager to help and knowing their neighborhood, being able to suggest local restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: frozenkiwi
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night in Le Select, and it was very pleasant. Pros: very friendly staff, you can take the included breakfast in-room, nice boutique-hotel style decor, comfortable bed, quiet sleep. The location is very nice, next to the Sorbonne and on a nice square with trees and a fountain, a short walk to the Seine and many sights. Cons: the soundproofing could be better as we could hear some noise from other bathrooms (a shower running or toilet flushing) -- but that was the only noise we heard. There's a bath with a handheld shower head only, and no door or curtain, so if you prefer a shower it's a bit awkward and you'll probably splash water everywhere. If I were the hotel, I'd install a glass door and mount the showerhead on the wall. (Given the price-per-night, I found that surprising.) And the door between the room and the bathroom is not at all soundproof, so you'd better be comfortable with your companion's bathroom habits...! For us, these were minor issues, we enjoyed the stay. Other comments: the rooms are small, but this is Paris, so to be expected... we didn't find the size of the room a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful localization,very nice view from the room,confortable.”
Reviews.Author: NBA95
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located,has a terrific view to Sorbonne from the room what makes it really charming.The staff is nice,the service is fine.I was surprised by it.The room was not big but it is confortable and clean.I would stay there again and will recommend to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “an excellent and convenient spot”
Reviews.Author: macadonald
Reviews.Content: This is a very clean and modern hotel that is very convenient for shopping and sightseeing

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: erobesc
Reviews.Content: We overstayed in this hotel for 3 days due to ash cloud caused by volcanic eruption in Iceland and they gave me half the price of the normal junior suite room rate. The staff are friendly and helpful and can speak english. The hotel location is great. Pretty much convenient. ATMs, SNCF, RER train station, tourist spots and lots of restaurants nearby. The room is pretty cozy and elegant. We have two LCD screen in my room (one in bedroom and the other in lounge). There is available internet in the room but you need to pay (no free internet in the room only in the reception). Air conditioning is centrally controlled so you cannot modify the settings. The hotel elevator is pretty small.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel in the best location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: BSMel
Reviews.Content: A short walk to to the best bookshop in Paris ( la Compagnie). A short walk to L'Odeon (Theatre plus the best Cinema complexes in Paris), easy access to la Sainte chapelle and St Germain des Pres and Oratoire of the Louvre for concerts. Lots of superb restaurants in easy reeach. Also the major museums. The Place de la Sorbonne itself and the Jardin Du Luxembourg are excellent for relaxing. Breakfast in the Vaults is always pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “I will certainly stay at the Select again”
Reviews.Author: Jalna_Marian
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay in this hotel. The staff were excellent, very helpful and friendly, the breakfast most enjoyable, and the room (although small) was lovely. My only problem was a banging noise at night when the lift was used, but otherwise the location could not be better - quiet and very central. I will certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: cityfan097
Reviews.Content: The Select is a great hotel,excellent location next to the Sorbonne on a quiet, picturesque square. The staff are very friendly and helpful and the rooms, although small, are great with very comfortable beds and good pillows. The bathroom was fine but the handheld showerhead in the bath and no shower door made regular showering pretty impossible without flooding the entire room. The seperate WC was very small. Public areas are beautifully designed. Excellent breakfast, can still taste the croissants! Will certainly visit again.

Reviews.Title: “The right hotel in the right place.”
Reviews.Author: UgodeUghis
Reviews.Content: It is a very cozy hotel, close to every kind of shops you need, near the RER and Metro station, clean and with a friendly and professional staff speaking several languages.

Reviews.Title: “An awsome hotel with great personel”
Reviews.Author: andersprintz
Reviews.Content: Ivé never been so satisfied with a visit at any Hotel ever. Everything from personal help to booking cabs. It all went with a breeze. I will come again, with my family next time! I will speak well for you in Social Media! /Anders Printz, http://twitter.com/2_0

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but falls down on the detail”
Reviews.Author: Roly100
Reviews.Content: What's frustrating about this hotel is that it has all the ingredients for a stand-out hotel experience, but it doesn't quite know how to put them together to achieve that. On the plus side: - The location is excellent, right on the Place de la Sorbonne, and not far from the metro. - The hotel is newly renovated with some chic/trendy design pieces in the common areas. So you get a good feel as you walk in. It feels cosy and warm. - The rooms are cosy and comfortable, but small. We got a superior room on an off-season deal on the net. This overlooked the square which was very nice. If the standard rooms are smaller, they must be very small indeed. - The staff are, in the main, very nice, friendly and helpful. On the negative side, they fell down on a lot of details: - We arrived early and wanted to leave our bags. We expected a storage room somewhere, but we were told to leave them in a public hallway which was out of sight of the receptionist. No ticket was given nor was any record kept. To be honest, anyone could have walked away with them. This is simply unacceptable at this level of hotel. It left a bad impression just when we were just starting our stay. - Internet wi-fi is free on the ground floor, but you have to pay if you want to use it upstairs! Again, at this level this sort of thing is just annoying. It meant people had to decamp down to the foyer in order to use the internet when they could simply be given the same code to use in their room. I felt like a child when I was told I had to come down with my laptop to the foyer before they would give me the code. Not the feeling I want on holiday when I'm paying hundreds of euros. Hotels in 2010 need to wake up and understand that paying extra for wi-fi annoys sooo many customers!! - The hotel seems to be a refurbishment job on an old hotel. It shows. Some of the rooms, corridors and stairs have odd-shapes and unexpected bumps and turns. For example, our room had a very odd-shaped bathroom which meant that there was a very small odd-shaped bath and only a hand-held shower head which could only be used if you sat down in the bath. It was very difficult (impossible!) to use this shower without some gymnastics and even then it resulted in wetting the whole floor, which in turn spilled right out into the bedroom as there was no door into the 'bathroom'. At this level of hotel you really expect a decent shower that works. - There was no room manual indicating the services the hotel offered. This seems a bit odd for this level of hotel. All in all, I think if you get a very good deal (we paid €120 for a superior room incl. breakfast) then you can overlook the details as the location etc. is spot on, and the feel of the hotel is good. However, if you are paying a lot more then I think the details will begin to annoy you. My sense is that their focus has been on the design (and presumably increased room rates as a result), but they haven't quite got to the level of detail needed to justify the high price level they are aiming at, as suggested by the rack rates posted on the back of the door.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: LaureAndCo
Reviews.Content: Our room was small but very well organised and perfectly clean. Location is very convenient for sightseeing and shoping and the view on La Sorbonne had a real plus. I will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic choice!”
Reviews.Author: PernilleS
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Paris and I now know how great it was to pick this hotel! The location is perfect for everything! The surroundings are nice, romantic and cozy and still you're in the middle of the city and we could almost walk to every attraction and could also find shops and restaurants very easily from there. When we got tired of walking it was so easy to find a metro-station. And in the afternoon we could go to the Luxembourg yard to relax an hour or two. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The neighboor cafés are nice - the waiters greeted us everyday since we ate there the first night. The hotel is beautifully decorated - very modern and clean. The room was not exactly like the picture of course, and it's very small because its Paris! But it was the same style and had a nice bed and nice bathroom. Our room didn't really have a view, which would have been nice, but not necessary at all. It was very quiet at night and the drapes were dark so we slept long and well - in the mornings we could hear the neighboor a bit but nothing special. It was nice to be able to have breakfast in the hotel every morning, and there were some different things - I wasn't super-impressed though and it could've been nice to have breakfast in a café one day, but since we already paid for it and it was so convenient and still very decent we had breakfast there all week. All in all - this hotel might be the best pick in Paris. I would love to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: AlaninBrussels
Reviews.Content: A very good value hotel centrally located on a quiet square - which makes a difference! Very welcoming staff too - so all in all fully recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and conveniently located hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Yan-Chan
Reviews.Content: Clean and conveniently located small hotel in Paris, close to metro/RER train from the airport and bus public transportation. the only 2 things that can be and should be improved are: Bathtub (needs a glass or plastic curtain-should not be difficult to install) and quality of breakfast. i would stay again there

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel. Beds and rooms are a little small. It is worth staying here.”
Reviews.Author: Hitcher13
Reviews.Content: We have traveled for Valentine's day to Paris and booked this very nice and clean hotel. The beds are a little small at 140 x 190 cm for a superior room. We've checked at the desk and they have told us that some rooms have a 150 x 200 cm bed which is better. Quartier Latin is a fine neighborhood and you can reach the Hotel from Gare du Nord very well using the RER B.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jamessurgeon
Reviews.Content: incredible staff , excellent location rooms somewhat small. some things needed repair in the bathroom

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in Paris located in a tranquil street”
Reviews.Author: PdubC
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently visited Select Hotel during New Year's eve weekend. We stayed for 2 nights and thoroughly enjoyed our visit there. For a 3 star hotel, Select Hotel is very good. The staff are helpful, the building exterior is beautiful located right next to the Sorbonne and the rooms are so clean and stylistically comforting. One of the great things about the hotel is that its situated near a main street but because its tucked away in a kind of non-driving street, its very very quiet! Because its in the Latin Quarter, there are plenty of great restaurants around - from cheap to very expensive. Definitely going back again!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recomended.”
Reviews.Author: MarkGuernsey
Reviews.Content: In choosing a hotel in Paris we considered the rewiews of other travellers and the Select Hotel Rive Gauche came highly recomended. It more than lived up to our expectations with helpful, English speaking staff, comfortable rooms and a good breakfast to set us up for the day. It is well located to visit the sights. Our room was small as was the bathroom, but we were there to see Paris, not to spend too much time in the room

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Kkrampus
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well positioned, at short distance from Notre Dame, St. Germain des Pres, very quiet. The room was small and the bathroom too. The elevator contains max 3 people and sometimes you must walk due to the long wait. The breakfast room is nice but rather small if all the guests decide to be there at the same moment.

Reviews.Title: “bed just 190cm long”
Reviews.Author: eddyeddyeddy
Reviews.Content: i am just back from paris and found the hotel really looking good. I booked a Room 1, Superior Double Room, not the standard room, not the junior suite. The room was good but missed a lot imo. Maybe I am spoiled or have to get used to paris but for 750 euros I got a double bed of just 190cm. (i am 193cm!!!!), there was no free wifi in room only at the reception, in the room 4,50 euro an hour, there was no lotion, no ironner, no small fridge, no tea or coffee maker. Strange....... Stay itself in paris perfect

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: nikatik
Reviews.Content: Located right next to the Sorbonne and just off Boulevard Saint Michel, The Select Hotel is a lovely, well-located little boutique hotel. The room was comfortable and clean, bed comfortable and the staff were friendly and helpful. We will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, modern rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Cheesus01
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Very modern. Foyer, bar & breakfast area where very well appointed. Polite but uninterested staff. Breakfast was a complete disappointment. Very average buffet of bread and some old looking cheese. Room was clean, had opening windows out into a nice little street/courtyard. Shower was not actually a shower, strange combination of bath & shower head on a hose. No shower curtain though! So showering was not really an option unless you sit in the bath and hold it over your head. :S No free WIFI internet in the room was also shattering. Good location, short walk to Notre Dam, the Louvre etc.

Reviews.Title: “Troubleless, Enjoyable Stay.”
Reviews.Author: SibylleLondon_
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I found everything to our satisfaction. The room was very pleasant, the facilities adequate for our needs. The staff were friendly and helpful and the breakfast well-presented. We were given correct advice and map with regard to travel. The atmosphere was relaxing and inviting and we felt comfortable

Reviews.Title: “exceptionally comfortable, friendly hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: antenne2
Reviews.Content: We spent four days in the hotel over Christmas and had a great time. The rooms are big enough and really warm and comfortable and the staff friendly and helpful. The hotel is an interesting mix of old and modern and is beautifully situated right next to the Sorbonne, There are lots of interesting sights and good places to eat within easy walking distance. I could have spent the whole time in the Latin Quarter cinemas but we did lots of other things too! My one criticism would be that the breakfasts, although very good, lacked a bit of variety. I would definitely recommend this hotel and want to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay; exceptional reception staff”
Reviews.Author: Travellerpqa
Reviews.Content: Great restaurant next door that was excellent food, reasonable, friendly. Marie Helen, one of the receptionist was exceptionally helpful and friendly. All of the staff was responsive, friendly and excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, nice hotel atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: citizenAthens
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent as well as the atmosphere of the hotel. The rooms are nice but small and the breakfast is poor taking into account the price. The separation of the bath and the toilet is not a happy solution.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: JandJWestSussex
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on recommendation by our son and his fiancee. Very impressed with the situation in that walking distance to most of the sights, close to Luxembourg or Cluny metro stations and near some friendly reasonably priced restaurants. Rooms were very clean and comfortable and the bed, bedding and pillows all good quality. Breakfast was fine and served in the "cellar" so very unique. Staff were friendly and helpful. We were only there 2 nights but would recommend it to others. Very impressed!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: gabgoub
Reviews.Content: If you need a quiet night in the middle of Paris, chose this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with friendly staff !”
Reviews.Author: ValleyDesi
Reviews.Content: The Select Hotel next to the Sorbonne is an awesome place that I highly recommend. My wife, our baby son and I went to Paris with a booking at a B&B - as soon as we got there we realized that it was a downright dive and unliveable. Got on the internet and found a reasonable deal at the Hotel Select in the Place de la Sorbonne - we left our luggage in a safe place and got to the hotel. Did a little back and forth negotiating based on the internet price and got them to quickly agree to offer us a room which was very close to the internet price. Once we came back with our luggage the receptionist took one look at what we had and promptly upgraded us to a bigger room at the same price ! Said that we needed it, especially with a baby (Paris is an awesome destination with a young baby). The hotel is super-clean with great amenities - it looks recently renovated although the basement breakfast room looks like it was part of an ancient building ... almost like the dungeon of a medieval castle. Great air-conditioning which was necessary in the summer, free high-speed wireless, breakfast in the morning (strongly recommend a heavy breakfast to save money and fortify the tissues for a full day of tramping around Paris). It's an awesome location, right next to the Sorbonne and also very central. The best thing though are the staff - so very helpful. Always looking to help us out, taking the time to get to know us and understand what we are looking for and helping us with awesome restaurant recommendations especially since we are vegetarian - I'm eternally grateful at being told about Tugalik restaurant !! Unfortunately I don't know the names of most of the staff members - but Michael, who was the night receptionist on many of the days we were there was truly helpful. A person who so strongly believes in the comfort of the guests.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: angelica780
Reviews.Content: The first room we were given was tiny (only bed plus minimal walking space, but did have shower)...but we asked if a larger one was available and the front door staff were happy to give us a little bigger room. The second room was much better and didn't feel quiet as claustraphobic. Breakfast was ok...more variety would have been nice...some eggs or meat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Papone
Reviews.Content: Nice room although a bit small. Good service and breakfast at buffet. Totally refurbished in an elegant but modern stay. Astonishing position: from my windows I could see the Sorbonne and the rooftops of Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for short break in Paris”
Reviews.Author: jewol
Reviews.Content: Excellent, compact and good quality hotel located a 5 minute walk from the Metro and RER Line B..The immediate area is not to touristy and located in a fairly quite square with bars and a good variety of places to eat and shop nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Fayekp
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel in a great location, literally right next to the Sorbonne, within 5 minutes of two metro stations, a couple more minutes up the hill at you're at the Luxemburg Gardens (worth a visit) and 10 minutes down the hill and you're at Notre Dame and the Seine. Hotel staff were friendly and accomodating. We had a late train home and they let us leave our baggage there all afternoon and we even popped back mid afternoon to drop some more stuff off. They called a cab for us for our return to the station and were always polite and smiling. Rooms were clean but small but only to be expected. Daily maid service, with fresh towels. We were on the first floor and it was a little noisy with the window open but air con worked well so again this was not a problem. There are two or three restaurants immediately out the front of the hotel, we only ate at one of them but they all looked busy most of the time. There is an area on the way down to Notre Dame literally a few minutes walk which has a huge selection of restuarants from standard french fare to greek, mexican and others. Also lots of souvenir shops, obviously aimed at tourists but handy if you don't want to travel to far to eat. On the whole a great experience and would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in the centre of Paris”
Reviews.Author: LondonMjm
Reviews.Content: This is a small, quiet hotel in an excellent location near the Sorbonne in the Latin Quarter. There are bars/restaurants next door to the hotel which is very handy, and Notre Dame, the Louvre and other sights are only a short stroll away. The Metro is also near by. Our room was well appointed with the only negative point being the shower which was attached to a hook situated low down on the wall over the bath which made for an interesting crouching-in-the-bath type shower - bizarre! If you're lucky enough to get a room on the top floor, then if it's facing onto the quiet square (Place Sorbonne) where the hotel is located then you can see over the rooftops all the way to the Sacre Coeur. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “DISCOVERING PARIS WITH MY DAUGHTER”
Reviews.Author: serge101
Reviews.Content: super nice location...breakfast very good....shower old style.....

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Paris”
Reviews.Author: Raymefa
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with our parents and wanted someplace with easy access. this was the place to go. Near Metro stops and also Hop on Hop Off stations, The hotel was set back from the street adjacent to Sorbonne University and was ideal, From the moment we checked in, until the moment we checked out, we received nothing but excellent service. The hotel was very modern and well furnished. The rooms were clean, a little small but very comfortable. They suggested a great place for dinner and also sold the passes to the hop on hop off which was a great way to get around the city. The breakfast room was typical European breakfast, lots of Carbs, but very good.

Reviews.Title: “Would highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: CassieUsa
Reviews.Content: Great location and helpful staff. Breakfast was included which is important considering the prices in Paris. Hotel is located on a pedestrian square in front of La Sorbonne University. Lots of students and people on the street. Nice Latin Quarter atmosphere. Close to the Metro and Nortre Dame. Numerous restaurants just outside the door. The room was average size for European standards and it appears the whole hotel has been recently remodeled. We enjoyed it, would recommend it, and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel; great location”
Reviews.Author: SeattleDavidleen
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel Select a dozen times and have always loved it. The rooms are small but neat and clean and modernized. The staff is very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: OsloParis
Reviews.Content: The room was nice. The elevator was very small. The location was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic piece of French culture”
Reviews.Author: KTUk
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time at this hotel. The room was beautiful, overlooking Place de la Sorbonne and with two big windows which opened out onto the square itself. The room itself was very clean and had everything we were loking for with a seperate toilet and bathroom. We adapted well to the bath only option as the shower was not really available in this room. We loved it though. Reception staff were perfect; extremely helpful and kind. They even called to change a restaurant reservation for us. Nothing was too much for them! Breakfast was simple but more than sufficient with a lovely gentleman replenishing. Croissants (jame and beautiful french butter), coffee, bread and cereals. Set us up nicely for the day! The hotel was very easily reached by RER line B either Luxembourg or St Michel. The location was very safe and not commercialised. We found some lovely places to walk and it is so close to Notre Dame and Isle St Louis. Musee D'Orsay is about 25 minute walk and Eiffel tour reachable but easier to take the RER Line C. We will stay here again without a second thought as it was a perfect base for our first stay in Paris. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - especially by Paris standards”
Reviews.Author: escottf
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a quick city break on Eurostar. Unlike may Paris (and London) hotels, this was modern, stylish and clean. Our room was small but had a modern, if not luxurious bathroom and seemed perfectly fine and clean. All the normal amenities you'd expect - TV, mini-bar, toiletries but basically a nice base to stay for the few moments we weren't out and about. The hotel is at the back of the square in front of the Sorbonne University. The reception staff were helpful - my only suggestion: that they provide receipts for left luggage. Anyone could have picked up ours and I wouldn't recommend leaving anything truly valuable in left luggage until they do so. Practicalities and tips: Closest station is Luxembourg RER - only 3 stops from Gare Nord on the RER (if you're coming in on Eurostar but also the same track for Charles de Gaulle or Orly airports). You're a short walk from the Pantheon, Latin Quarter and Luxembourg Gardens and not much further from Notre Dame or the Église Saint-Sulpice. If, like us, you decide to dine in the square *outside* the hotel (nothing to do with the hotel itself), be careful. We did for breakfast (instead of the free one in the hotel) and didn't stick with the set-menu - €45 later (for 2), the most expensive breakfast I've ever had. That said it was good, and if you stick with the set menu, we could have had the same for €30. Just a warning.

Reviews.Title: “Greater than expected”
Reviews.Author: Jenniferfl
Reviews.Content: What a great reception we got at the front desk when we check in while we were there and when we check out. The room was great, clean comfortable and wonderful amenities . I would recommend this property to everyone .

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for a quick trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: KermitNottingham
Reviews.Content: A modern, clean, comfortable hotel in a good location. Friendly staff, good breakfast choices. Air conditioning was a welcome bonus as August in Paris was very hot.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing for a 3 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peems
Reviews.Content: I can't recommend this hotel highly enough for any couple travelling to Paris. As most Parisian hotels are a let down in terms of the room size and quality, even in 4 and 5 star hotels, The Select Hotel is a real breath of fresh air. My wife was convinced I had booked a higher grade and more expensive hotel when we walked in and went to our room. The entrance to the hotel lies directly opposite the Sorbonne in a nice square with some restaurants and cafes (of varying quality) within easy reach on foot of either the Luxembourg or Saint Michel RER Stations (direct from Charles De Gaulle Airport). The first signs of quality lie in the very modern style of the reception area, and the pleasant welcome from the helpful staff. This continues throughout the hotel's main communal areas which are all well appointed with nice leather sofas and wooden fittings, especially the library/bar area. Our room was on the fifth floor overlooking the inner courtyard, but no real view to speak of. However, this was not a major concern for us given the quality of the room itself. Again, very modern fittings with quality woods and nice linen. The flatscreen TV and safe were also welcome additions. The only area where things could be improved is the bathroom, where there is no stand-up shower, rather a bath with shower attachment. Given the quality of everything else though, I am clutching at straws. Everything was clean on arrival and thoroughly every day by the maids. It is worth pointing out as well that we were in the lowest class of room! Another plus point for the hotel was the breakfast buffet, as many Parisian hotels charge extra for this, or do not include it at al. The fayre is very 'continental' in style with breads, cereals and excellent strong coffee, so those wanting something cooked or more traditional would have to look elsewhere. Finally, the hotel is in easy reach of a lot of the main sites, and a lot of nice restaurants (though keep an eye on the price increases as you walk down the hill towards Notre Dame as every 100 yards seems to add a Euro!) and cafes. Check out is suitably laid back at 12 o'clock at the latest so we had time to enjoy a relaxing breakfast and then pack and make our way home content. We have already decided to go back to the same hotel in the winter.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and”
Reviews.Author: EastSussexRoz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location, within walking distance of the Seine. It is well designed with a modern boutique look. Our room was small but pleasing to the eye as was the bathroom, although no bath, just a shower, which was fine with us. Everything was clean and new looking. It was nice and quiet and the air conditioning was effective. My only suggestion would be to put a mirror over the desk so that I could put my makeup on while my husband monopolised the bathroom. Breakfast was continental but plenty to eat, and the staff were polite and helpful. The lift is very small and although it states that it holds three people, they would have to be quite slim. We found a very pretty art nouveaux restaurant in nearby rue Racine called Grand Bouillon, where we had a good meal at a reasonable price. I would definitely recommend the hotel to friends and would stay there again when next in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint little hotel designed with a modern influence, Perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: nigelgresley
Reviews.Content: Perfect location over looking La Sorbonne. Just as described by the website and rooms perfect ambience for romantic break. Superb design features in the lounges and breakfast room. only thing that was a little disappointing was the shower; attachment to the bath and no showere curtain/shield. Otherwise absolutely perfect. It is located just on the edge of the latin quarter, loads of restaurants to choose from and only 15 mins stroll to Notre Dame and the river Seinne. Would highly recommend this hotel to travellers looking for a romantic break.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Stylish, Modern, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: parisnicole8
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Clean, stylish, modern, convenient. Everything looks newly renovated. Excellent location next to Sorbonne and just a couple blocks from the Luxembourg Gardens (don't miss it!) and the Pantheon. Also don't miss the cute Rue de Mouffetard behind the Pantheon. The rooms are sort of small but that's very normal for Paris. (Previously we stayed in the Best Western Aramis on Rue de Renne, and that was ridiculously tiny and not nearly as clean and modern.) Included breakfast - great croissants, cereal, etc. Lobby staff was very helpful w/ good English. Unfortunately you can't get an iron in your room -- need to take your clothes downstairs if you want to iron -- but maybe that's how it goes in Europe. It's about 10 min walk to the Cluny/Sorbonne Metro.

Reviews.Title: “good clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Meena72
Reviews.Content: We are had already walked passed the hotel, when eventually the hotel was pointed out to us. We entered a lovely minimalist foyer and were greeted by a member of staff. We were given our key and we made our own way up to our room in a small lift. A clean but compact en-suite room awaited us. It was exactly as we had expected.
