The staff were good friendly and were, importantly, able to converse with us in English. They provided us with a map of the city which had their contact details on it, should we need it!! The hotel overlooked a well frequented square. At night it could get very noisy and we had to close the blinds, but it was nice to experience the nightlife. Overall, a pleasent and clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with a French atmosphere in the middle of the city”
Reviews.Author: FranzHeidelberg
Reviews.Content: The hotel has very nice rooms and the location is great at a nice place. You can walk to Quartier Latin and Notre Dame. Breakfast is pretty French. That means it doesnt have a lot of offers. Could be improved for international travelers. Overall we had a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Fresh and friendly hotel.”
Reviews.Author: StranaGirl
Reviews.Content: This was a second visit to this hotel. Located right in front of the entrance to the Sorbonne, the hotel is both relatively quiet, yet on a lively square. Really close to St. Germain, great shopping, walking distance to lots. Also close to both the Metro and RER which is super convenient to and from CDG airport. Service is friendly and accommodating. Rooms are on the small side but fresh and comfortable. Breakfast is standard but OK. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: mortimer
Reviews.Content: I have beeen lucky enough to work in Paris on and off for the last few years - so have seen a good many business class hotels. I have also had the "pleasure" of several standard 3star hotels. This time I was returning on a leisure trip with my wife & daughter. After much deliberation I chose this hotel - and am happy I did so. The room we had (no 29 - Triple Room) at Select Rive Gauche compared very favourably with the business hotels (Meridian etc) in terms of space, cleanliness, quality of beds/bedding, sound proofing etc., and considerably better than the normal tired old Paris 3 star. Bathroom was spacious for a change - with bath, double sink & wc. Only complaint would be the lack of real shower - the shower is attached to the tap and can only be hand held - not even a hook on the wall. Breakfast thrown in is a bonus - it's not brilliant but is fresh & substantial, presented buffet style - so you can eat/drink as much as you want. Overall decor is modern and light, bar and sitting areas are attractive. All staff seemed friendly and with a good grasp of English ( although, as ever, any attempt at French is appreciated) Location is excellent - the square has cafes, sandwich shop & restaurants etc. Easy walk to the river and several main tourist attractions plus several metro lines to get to the rest. Some of the areas near the river are very "touristy" - very lively if that's what you want, but it's only a short stroll to the more traditional Paris if you prefer. For a decent French style meal try Le Petite Chatelet - next to the Shakspeare book shop - by the river aboiut 10 mins walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Friendly Staff; So-So Room”
Reviews.Author: ksummerlee
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Paris over Easter weekend with my SO. We had a reservation at another hotel in the area, but upon arrival we discovered that it was still partly under construction. We made the decision to stay elsewhere. We ended up booking the Select Hotel in a rush after reading reviews and looking at photos on TA and Expedia. The price was right and the location was spot-on. Upon arrival we were given a room that overlooked the plaza; however, it had not been renovated like the photos we'd seen, and only had a tub in bathroom. We requested a room with a shower, and were given room 76 on the back side of the hotel. Although the room was renovated, it didn't have the exposed stone, ceiling beams, shower and tub like we thought all the rooms had based on all the photos we'd seen. The room was comfortable enough, but we were dissapointed given what we were expecting. If you are going to stay here, I would request a "Superior Room". Location could not be better; you are close to the Metro, basically on top of the Sorbonne, a stones throw from St. Michel, Saint Germain, Notre Dame, an easy walk to Marais etc. You could get to anywhere in Paris in minutes. Breakfast included in the rate makes this a little better value for what you are paying. The staff was helpful, friendly and spoke great English; I believe they appreciate attempts at speaking French however, as most Parisans do. Overall I would recommend this hotel for it's location and staff if you plan on spending as little time in your room as we did; if you are hoping for more from your room, then unless you get a superior room I would consider elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: alex_bygrave
Reviews.Content: We had a perfect time at this wonderful time, everyone was friendly, rooms were clean and beautiful although the bath was very small but we still just loved it. The area the hotel was in was lovely with great restaurants close by. All in all a wonderful hotel

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: phxhoney
Reviews.Content: Select Hotel was so wonderful! Modern decor, friendly staff, continental breakfast included, GREAT location (walking to Notre Dame, Latin Quarter, Pantheon, St. Michelle, St. Germain, Luxenburg gardens, Metrostop), cafes and shopping next to the hotel, and our view was of the Sorbonne! The concierge helped us find nightclubs and made reservations at restaurants for us. We had a triple room which was a bit cramped but not for Paris. I would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: westham07
Reviews.Content: Warm welcome, decent room, lovely breakfast, great location. All you'll ever need in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice looking but average”
Reviews.Author: mrmojorisin75
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well located, very well located actually. It also looks the part as it's well designed/decorated internally. Problems: small everything, to be expected in Paris granted but no so small that they can't even fit a stand up shower in the bathroom!!! Inclusive breakfast was very simple, nothing to write home about, nice coffee though! All in all a decent stay, did 4 city trip of Europe and this was the least value of all four hotels I'd say, but certainly not terrible by any means.

Reviews.Title: “loved the decor”
Reviews.Author: margaret279
Reviews.Content: We did not know what to expect but we were greeted warmly by the concierge (a first!) and our room (we had upgraded to deluxe) was beautiful. It had original features (stone wall and ceiling beams) but it was furnished in a modern style with many lights (ceiling, table lamps, bed lights etc). The foyer of the hotel was stepped with plants and a water feature which really gave the hotel a smart appearance. We did not expect a bath, only a shower, but the bath was there. The room overlooked a quiet square with fountains with some brasseries nearby. The only disappointment was breakfast, which was unexpectedly for Paris included in the price. It was basic - bread, croissants, cheese, and coffee, We have been spoiled with another hotel whose breakfast is vast! Overall I would definitely go back and stay there. It is in such a convenient area off St Michel and within walking distance of many of the tourist spots.

Reviews.Title: “A little untidy and not so great customer service”
Reviews.Author: gss517
Reviews.Content: I always use tripadvisor to make my choices for hotels, because the reviews are good. So based from the reviews I expected a decent hotel and decent is exactly what we received. The hotel was in a good location. I understand rooms will be small but I really choose the hotel based on the bathrooms, because I like modern and clean bathrooms. Our room #76, was definitely modern but the bathroom was not clean, by means of mildew and mold in the grout of the shower tiles. I did ask the night time manager to please make a note but nothing was done in the 4 nights we stayed there. The night time manager was simply awful, rude and made us feel very unwelcome from the moment we checked in. He gave us our key at check in didn't tell us how to get to the room, so we took the wrong elevator and since the hotel is divided we couldn't reach our room from the main stair ways. We had to ask him how to get there and only pointed in the right direction and said "2nd floor". The heat wasn't working and we called him and he said "it will come"and then hang up before I could ask more questions. When we asked if the Champs Elysees was close enough to walk or should we take the train, he told us he couldn't know what was good for us and go to the train station to make the decision. This guys was unbelievable. So that is how our nightly visits went for 4 days, on the very opposite the day time receptionists were great and helpful and so welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but not really value for money”
Reviews.Author: CathalRock
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for this hotel when I booked it... pictures looked good, it was about 12th on the trip advisor list with solid reviews etc. It didn't quite live up to those hopes, but that not to say it's a bad place. There are some good things and some not so good things to say about our stay. On the good side, there is a nice atmosphere in the hotel: it's nicely designed and kept, and the staff are friendly and helpful. It's also in a great location... by the Sorbonne, 10 minutes(ish) walk from Notre Dame, 5 minutes from the Metro if that, plenty of bars and restaurants nearby. Rooms are also clean and well kept. On the less good, the room was basically not enough for the money. Of course, it's well understood that hotel rooms are generally on the small side in Paris, but for £140 per night you expect a bit more than a boxy room barely longer than the bed itself, even it's comfortable enough and clean. But this might have been acceptable, were it not for the lack of a proper shower. Just looking through other people's pics I see other rooms have this too.. we had a flat round disc showerhead, which attaches to the wall somewhere around your waist, meaning that you have to physically hold it to shower with it. This was frankly irritating - dunno about you, but I generally use both hands to shower with! Secondly, the cord wasn't quite long enough to get above your head (I'm 5'8", so not a giant), so you had to crouch to shower your head. Maybe I'm just being picky? But I didn't like it. So all in all, I didn't feel it was value for money. Next time I'm in Paris I'll choose somewhere a little further out, and get something better for the cash. It looks as if the superior rooms are bigger, and if you're planning to book one of those perhaps you'll be completely happy with the place. But if your budget is similar to mine, then I'd suggest looking for something less ideally located, which provides more for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: h1bah1ba
Reviews.Content: I found an amazing deal through Expedia (stay 2 nights, get the 3rd night free), and booked 3 nights in this hotel. I was travelling alone, and wanted a hotel that was close to everything and where I felt safe. This hotel was it. The room was average by Parisian standards. Not super tiny, but not what we are used to in the States. The room was cozy and comfortable. It had everything you needed after a long day of walking around Paris. The bed was extremely comfortable, and even though I booked a single, I ended up with a double. The best part of the room? The shower! The bathroom is small, but the shower head makes up for it. It's one of those that is in the ceiling and it rains down on you...a marvelous way to end a day of site seeing. The location is perfect. Easily accessible by a Metro stop and an RER stop. You can get to just about anywhere you want to go from either of these stops. Also, the nearby Metro stop has a transfer to the RER line (B) that takes you right to CDG airport. You go down to the Cluny/Sorbonne stop and follow the signs that say Line B towards CDG Airport. Once on the B line, you go straight to the airport. There is a Monoprix supermarket right down the road if you want to pick up snacks, drinks, or picnic items (the Luxembourg Garden, right down the street, is perfect for a picnic lunch). The only downside was breakfast. All of the breads were day old at best, and the cheese offerings were warm. The coffee was terrible. Cold and watered down. Breakfast was included in my room package. If not, I say, save your money and grab a croissant at one of the many boulangeries you'll find along the road. Next time I go to Paris, I will definitely stay at the Select hotel. I can't recommend it enough.

Reviews.Title: “Claustraphobic Lifts”
Reviews.Author: double07
Reviews.Content: The website is somewhat deceptive as all the bedrooms shown must be more than the standard ones so beware when booking. We stayed in a standard room on the 5th floor(only two rooms on each floor on the wing we were in) reached by a tiny,tiny lift or very narrow,winding steps. Room was small but typical of other hotels we have stayed in when in Paris. The space in the room had been utilised well. We only had a view of the rear of rooms located at the front of the hotel & the wall of the adjacent cafe. Breakfast (self service) was satisfactory, comprising of a choice of cereal, tinned fruit, natural yogurt, croissants, small baguette type rolls, jam &/or cheese plus as much coffee or tea or powdered chocolate as we wanted. The size of the breakfast room, located in the hotel basement, was very small & there was always a queue not only for the food but also for a table too. Another person helping to clear tables & restock trays, cutlery etc is definitely needed. There are plenty of cafes/bars close by serving from early morning to late at night if you need a drink as there are no tea/coffee making facilities in the room, but as always, I took a travel kettle & coffee. Ideal location, we walked to all the tourist spots & were close to the Metro too. Reception staff were very helpful & polite & spoke excellent English. I would stay there again but in a superior room.

Reviews.Title: “classy and chic!”
Reviews.Author: suffragettecitygirl
Reviews.Content: i stayed here with my boyfriend for one night in september 2008. we had been traveling around europe for 8 weeks and decided to splurge on a nice hotel for our last night in paris (which was also the last night of our trip). we saw the website and fell in love with the modern room design and the cactus garden in the lobby. we had a superior double room overlooking place de sorbonne. it was lovely! our room was very spacious and looked out over the fountains in the square. the bed was so fluffy my bf had to literally drag me out of it in the morning, and the bathroom was beautiful! there was a nice big tub to soak in, but no shower curtain, so we had to be careful when showering, but it wasn't a problem. the toilet was in a separate room from the tub/sink and there was a frosted panel between the two that allowed light to flow through... it was beautiful. the staff were extremely nice, and offered to store our bags for us when we were checking out if we wanted to go sightseeing for the day. the breakfast included with the price of the room was a nice touch. it was self serve fruit, cereal, little pastries, juice, coffee, and tea. it was simple and perfect. we loved the select so much, we will probably stay there for the entire length of our next stay in paris!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: quicksilver_girl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a four night stay in the Select Hotel Paris based on the great reviews it received on this site and we were not disappointed. The hotel is perfectly located on a quiet place by the Sorbonne between the Latin Quarter and the Jardin du Luxembourg. You get the benefit of being right in the heart of the bustling, relaxed cafe district of Paris but with peace and quiet when you need it. The hotel itself is very well presented in a modern style and staff were extremely friendly and helpful. We had a standard room which looked like it had recently been refurbished and was decorated in lovely neat style, modern with nice touches such as a beamed ceiling, and a brand new shower room/WC, also very bright and contemporary. There have been some comments that the rooms are small but a good size for Paris and there was plenty of room to wander around for two of us with two big suitcases! Breakfast was included in our booking and was held in the characterful cavernous basement; we found it to be good, continental fare ie pastries, fruit, cereals, ham and cheese etc. It certainly filled us up well until lunchtime! From the hotel we were able to see most of the obvious sites on foot. We were a 5 minute stroll from Notre Dame and 10-15 mins walk from the Louvre and the Musee D'Orsay. The hotel was so well placed that we found an hour's pleasant walk around could bring you to most places easily. If not, then the hotel is minutes from the St Michel Metro / Train Station. From here we could get to and from the airport and to other sites, such as Chateau Versailles, not to mention anywhere in the city with ease. We were moments walk from the Latin Quarter which was packed full of lovely brasseries, cafes and bistros for lunch and dinner. You could stay there for months and never go to the same place twice and most places have great traditional french food at very reasonable prices. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Select Hotel and would highly recommend it to anyone. I am planning a return trip and will definitely be staying there again!

HotelInfo.Name: Select Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 1 Place Sorbonne, 75005 Paris, France
